artisticAlley.name: 3D Digital Design Screening
artisticAlley.description: Come sit and rest for a while as you watch work produced by students in the 3D Digital Design program at RIT.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Marla Schweppe, Yao Tong

artisticAlley.name: A Behind the Scenes Look at Filmmaking
artisticAlley.description: Lights...Camera...Action! Walk into Studio A and be transported to a live film set! From lighting and camera equipment to giant 'wild walls' (walls on wheels that can be used to create different locations), visitors will catch a glimpse of just how time and labor intensive it is to film a movie and why it takes weeks, if not months, to be able to call 'That's a wrap!'
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Mark Foggetti, Reinaldo Gentile-Rondon, Emily Kordovich, Olivia Metellus, Michael Tellup, Aaron Tran, Kevin Villafuerte, Jose Hildalgo Thormann, Lei Wu, Bichen Yang

artisticAlley.name: Activating the (Vignelli) Archives
artisticAlley.description: This course is a special project developed in conjunction with The Vignelli Center for Design Studies and the graduate Industrial Design program. Students used observations made from the objects they studied in the archives to create new designs.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Josh Owen

artisticAlley.name: Advertising Large Scale Production Shoot
artisticAlley.description: We can be found in the University Gallery in the Booth Building 7A. Come be photographed by The Advertising Photography Dept. and get a 4'x 6' print as a souvenir!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Clay McBride

artisticAlley.name: Ambio
artisticAlley.description: Ambio is a modern take on the classic mood ring. Using the biometric tracking capabilities of wearable technology, Ambio interprets your emotions and shares them with the people closest to you.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Conner Hasbrouck, Colton Woytas, Julianne Burke, Joshua Ladisic, Jessica Wiltey, Vincent Lin, Sudarshan Ashok Kumar, Bennoni Thomas

artisticAlley.name: Art House LED Board
artisticAlley.description: Art House is constructing an LED display board to be installed in the floor's window, equipped with high-grade technology to allow for wireless access, advanced animation capacity, and a custom built frame. Art House is a Special Interest House that lives in Colby D that brings together people of all disciplines and areas of study with a common interest in art and design, and now we are using ImagineRIT as an opportunity to consolidate the many talents found on floor into one product.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Sean Herman, Matthieu Mouthon, Tyler Reimold, Tyler Clark, Sally Boniecki, Nils Aldeborgh, Elizabeth Dettmann

artisticAlley.name: Breakdancing: Performance Art
artisticAlley.description: Hi! We are RIT's Breakdance Club!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Emily Beagles

artisticAlley.name: Brilliant: Learning and Discovery Center
artisticAlley.description: Brilliant: Learning and Discovery Center is an interactive, immersive experience that promotes personal discovery through physical and digital exploration. This exhibit demonstrates different types of intelligences and skills that are unique to everyone. Visitors are encouraged to explore their interests through a hands-on experience that includes a variety of closed panels that contain physical objects, facts, audio, or screens that reveal insights into personal learning style.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Dennae Makel, Maria Ace, Abbey Jo Leyendecker, Lauren Mays, Trista Finch, Isha Mehta, Trevor Canham

artisticAlley.name: Collabyrinth: Cooperative VR Maze Game
artisticAlley.ageRange: Family Friendly. Best suited for 4th grade and up
artisticAlley.description: Collabyrinth is a cooperative, educational maze game in virtual reality. Work together to defeat the evil wizard and restore the four seasons to the kingdom!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Kelly Hurlburt, Carly Kraft, Lauren Carney, Danielle Gray, Keith Delk, Nyrih Smith, Jane Rosenthal

artisticAlley.name: DesignAR History
artisticAlley.description: Sophomore Graphic Design majors in Kelly Murdoch-Kitt and Melissa Warp's Interactive Media Design Class invite you to learn about the history of computing, the internet, and interactive design through an engaging augmented reality exhibit. From 19th century mathematicians whose work gave birth to modern computing to cutting-edge contemporary designers, come learn about some of the key players who have helped give shape to our current digital lives.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Kelly Murdoch-Kitt, Melissa Warp, Leandra Baldwin, Taylor Butler, Abby Davis, Matthew Roeder, Taylor Samuels, Michaela Sansouci, Meeya Tjiang, Christine Van, Cindy Castillo Lake, Kathy Liu, Madison Mitchell, Htaw Pakao, Arianna Wagar, Laura Stockman, Sam Mancha, Emma McKeon-White, Abigail Dye

artisticAlley.name: Design Your Own Decorative Tile
artisticAlley.description: The School of Individualized Study allows students to tailor their degree programs to their interests and career goals. Please stop by and visit the student council members of SOIS to design and create your own personalized decorative tile.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Wendy Giuliano, Abby Cantwell, Ben Suits Baer, Sandra Malinowski, Devin Kalish, Eric Tong, Frankie Albin, Aishwarya Totad, Weston Hall

artisticAlley.name: Digital Clay using Zbrush
artisticAlley.description: This demonstration is going to show off the many features of Zbrush. The latest in modeling techniques without the constraints of dealing with technical limitations will be shown. We will have visual demonstrations, as well as an area to try it out yourself.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Mark Reisch, Levi Davis, Sarah Dunton, Isabel Marte

artisticAlley.name: Explore Digital Humanities & Social Sciences @ RIT
artisticAlley.ageRange: Best suited for middle school on
artisticAlley.description: Digital Humanities and Social Sciences is a new, interdisciplinary B.S. degree program, jointly offered by COLA, GCCIS, and CIAS, that uses computing technology to advance research in the humanities and social sciences. This exhibit will introduce visitors to the new major through a display of exciting student and faculty research projects in this field, including video games, digital history archives, and museum exhibits.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Tamar Carroll, Joshua Meltzer, Dillon Guscott, Everett Kline, Jennifer Roeszies, Hailey Cothran, Melissa Fanton, Rebecca DeRoo, Kelli Smampinato, Daniel Worden, Christopher Fisher, David Simkins

artisticAlley.name: Explore Interactive Team Projects
artisticAlley.description: Come and explore the intersection of design and technology through team projects. Students from two programs (MFA Visual Communication Design and MS Human Computer Interaction) have created projects integrating a mix of skills. From interactive APPS to 3D modeling to websites, you can talk with the students and view their projects.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Nancy Ciolek, David Halbstein, Khushboo Rajesh Agarwal, Akshay Kumar Arun, Chris Branch, Shiwen Ding, Wentao Huang, Kaiqi Jiang, Yunke Liu, Johanna Lopez Taveras, Jing Lyu, Rohan Patel, Noelia Rivera Pagan, Surudhakeerthi Sivakumar, Huangzhi Tang, Evgenia Tranevskaya, Parsuree Vatanasirisuk, I-Tang Wu, ying xing, Zhouxin Xu, Yue Zhang, Zheng Zhang

artisticAlley.description: Farewell to Dawn is a Mixed Reality Dance Performance in a Virtual Space. Two dancers in separate physical spaces wear Augmented Reality glasses so that they can perform together as motion controlled avatars in the same virtual world. The virtual world is a plaza with an Italian Cafe.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Marla Schweppe, Joe Geigel, Victoria McGowen, Zhongyuan Fa, Anastasia Pembrook, Nathan Stevens

artisticAlley.name: Formed Forging and Casting Materials
artisticAlley.description: Studio Demonstrations: Metals and Jewelry
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Juan Carlos Caballero-Perez , Meredith Hardiman, Baker Brett, Kaeun Jang

artisticAlley.name: Graphic Design Logo Remix
artisticAlley.description: This is an experiment in crowdsourced creativity! Participants are invited to draw, color, sketch, glue and create their own variations of Graphic Design program's new social media logo. Each participant will receive a logo template sheet, and there will be ample materials available to get the creative juices flowing! Individual pieces will be featured on our social media platforms along with a completed animation involving each sketch. All skill levels are encouraged to take part!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Cameron Czadzeck, Kelly Murdoch-Kitt, Isabel Bulling

artisticAlley.name: Habit Awareness
artisticAlley.description: Join us for Habit Awareness in the Quad outside of James E. Booth!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Lauren Heary, Datoria Harvey, Dan Caruso, Anthony Dreas, Karina Marichal

artisticAlley.name: Habitat for Humanity Maze
artisticAlley.description: Our Habitat for Humanity maze has been a signature attraction for years at Imagine RIT. The club members come together to design and construct a new student designed maze every year with the intention of introducing children and families to the awesome power of service and construction. Most of all we want our visitors to have a fun and relaxing time with our exhibit at Imagine.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Hannah Barber, Jenn Palmer, Meghan O'Neil, Hye Joon Kim, Naomi Magee, Natalie Magee, Adrianna Wellin, Jason Zheng, Scott Humski, Nur Shazwani Ramli, Courtney Hunt

artisticAlley.name: Hollywood Sound Magic for Film & Animation
artisticAlley.description: The roar of a '67 muscle car with YOU in the driver's seat: come find out what 5.1 SURROUND SOUND can do to power you up!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Dave Sluberski, Josh Banach, Connor McGlynn, Sandra Sluberski

artisticAlley.name: Hot Shots! Thermal Portraits
artisticAlley.description: Technology that was reserved for the military just a few short years ago has now found its way into the palm of your hand. Our Thermal Imager records and displays temperatures ranging from 14 to 302F. Get a photograph of the heat generated by your own body. See the Heat... Exhibitors: Bob Rose, Hayleigh Braml, Patrick Damiano, Madelyn Hammond, Kristen Hanley, Kelsey Kreider, Ian Longton, Christian Lusardi, Paige Pham, Ethan Whitecotton
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Bob Rose, Hayleigh Braml, Kristen Hanley, Patrick Damiano

artisticAlley.name: IDSA RIT
artisticAlley.description: Exhibitors will get a strong sense of industrial design at RIT and be able to try it out for themselves.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Francesco Barletta, Sumin Oh, Sophie Becker, Shima Ghaheri

artisticAlley.name: Illustration Showcase
artisticAlley.description: See a huge variety of beautiful artwork created by students in the illustration program, interact and watch students paint in front of you, or color a piece of student-created artwork to take home!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Ray Miller, Lee Brown, Jessica Adams, Taylor Rakocy, Madeleigh Place, Erin Salo, Gabe Levitt, Abby Coleman, Shay Lawhorn, Alexis Emma, Nadia Wakabayashi, Ivan Hayes, Unique Fair, Angie Krieg, Alexis Jeffries, Adena Smith

artisticAlley.name: Image Nation
artisticAlley.description: This exhibit will allow the community to see photographers working in the field as well as see what its like to be in a newsroom as content gets updated. The exhibit is part stationary, with editors working in a lab to edit and update the Image Nation website, and part mobile, with photographers documenting Imagine RIT events.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Emily Hunt, Kaitlyn Dolan, Daniel Vasta, Jenn Poggi, Joshua Meltzer, William Snyder, Joseph Ressler, Molly Richardson, Danielle DeVries, Sara Collins, Boris Shirman, Evan Maloney, Brittainy Newman, Dominique Hessert, Michael Owens, Maria Paula Ospina, Catherine Rafferty, Svea Elisha, Parker Bryant-Carty, Tia Weiss, Ellen O'Neill, Kristina Kaszei , Cuauhtemoc Paz, Malinda Ruit, Cassidy Keith, Jed Plumley, Santiago Zurbia Flores Otero

artisticAlley.name: Interaction, 3D, & Motion Graphics Design Thesis
artisticAlley.description: Try out an interactive project and give feedback, watch a motion graphic story, or view interesting 3D imaging. With concepts ranging from APPS to interactive exhibits, come explore this exhibit of Visual Communication Design MFA graduate student's thesis projects in progress. This is where design and technology intersect. Students are present to answer questions and discuss their concepts.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Nancy Ciolek, Shalaka Haldankar, Yun Liu, Carolina Lopez Corominas, Aparna Natraj, Ernest Roszkowski, Maria Gabriela Sanchez Angulo, Jenna Shay, Yao Tong, Hanxi Xie, Jiaqi Yang, Anem Syed, Yu He, Emili Koui, Wenhan Lin, Elizabeth Richardson, Mengying Wang, Yun-Chieh Emma Hsieh, Karie Carita, Shaemus Spencer

artisticAlley.name: Interactive Cave Art Exhibit For Children
artisticAlley.description: Experience an interactive and immersive Upper Paleolithic cave art exhibit.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Jim Parrillo

artisticAlley.name: Interruptions
artisticAlley.ageRange: It's appropriate for all ages but it's recommended for those of high school age and older.
artisticAlley.description: Through Interruptions, we hope to give visitors a space to realize the value of unexpected connections and gain appreciation for our shared human experience. This experience is an interactive walkthrough where two strangers connect through a series of prompts, generating a collaborative piece of art. By witnessing how different perspectives make beautiful imagery, visitors will leave with an awareness that different human experiences promote a more beautiful world.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Autumn Coyle, Laura Silva, Todd Williams, Natasha Mistry, Caleb Payne, Joe Kramer, Andrea Montealegre, Zoë Gomer

artisticAlley.name: Luma
artisticAlley.description: Create an imaginary friend, and watch them come to life! Luma is an interactive exhibit that will have you customize and color in an imaginary creature on a large, wall-sized interface with a magic paintbrush. Then teach them important skills to achieve their dream job through interactive mini-games. Luma uses the character creation journey to encourage empathy and creativity.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Sophia Herdzik, Jasmine Pazer, Wei-Wei Huang, Arietta Tetreault, Cailin Li, Ryan Hirsch

artisticAlley.name: Make Your Very Own Flagbook
artisticAlley.description: Take this opportunity to create your very own pop-up book utilizing a structure called the 'flag book.' A flag book is created with paper flags that are applied to an accordion-folded piece of paper. The paper flags go in different directions allowing them to pop up when the book is opened. The pieces are glued into two book covers to create your own custom flag book. This process will take about 20-30 minutes to complete.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Eric Kunsman, Nancy Marrer, Sidonie Roepke, Shannon Connell, Laural Hartman, Andrea Zuchengo, Amanda Keenan, Samantha Abert, Amelia Milling, Miko Arayata, Victoria Pon, Lilly Bean, Lindsay Olson, Cassandra Banania, Zifeng Zeng, Edward Mineck, Kayla O'Brien

artisticAlley.name: Media Sciences Showcase
artisticAlley.description: This interactive exhibit showcases recent projects in new media publishing and functional print. Featured new media projects include the 'RocReadaR' augmented reality application created at RIT, and mixed reality publishing with Microsoft Hololens. Functional print projects will showcase 3D printing workflows, and techniques for creating authentic digital print archives.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Michael Riordan, Elena Fedorovskaya , Yash Jain, Ashish Baheti, Sedera Zbranak, Arun Gopinathan, Sanjana Kapisthalam, Andy Charlot, Sean Fagan, Alexander Greenhalgh, Connor Butters, Joi Overby, Megan Cooper

artisticAlley.name: MST Art Education Art Activity and Face Painting
artisticAlley.description: Stop by the Art Education Graduate Program table to create an art project and get your face painted!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Lauren Ramich, Nicholas Doremus, Melissa Kuter, Misti Roe, Melanie Martinek, Janet Gibbons, Robert Antonucci

artisticAlley.name: Open Figure Drawing
artisticAlley.description: Come try your hand at life drawing from a clothed model. Easels, drawing materials and paper will be provided. Ask for tips on portrait drawing and active figure gestures from RIT students and Instructors. See in-progress and finished student work. Open to all ages and experience levels.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Emily Glass, Julie Christensen-Landes, Sarah Saunders, Ye Ri Park, Juli Stocker, Brittany Bland, Estefania Blanco, Alex Mercando, Larissa Dale, Gracie Canfield, Nicole Simone, Wesley Odell, Taylor Rakocy, Sharon Varshay, Sophia Wojnovich, Kristy Younglove, Fuad Aloor, Danielle Burgess, Yahui Gao, Bradley Kwarta, Lingfei Zhao

artisticAlley.name: Re-Imagining the Future
artisticAlley.description: We've had our fill of negativity--dystopian visions of the future abound. Visitors are invited to sit down and present their own speculative ideas for a positive future in which all people and our planet can thrive. The final video piece will weave together the ideas, visions, and hopes generated into a collectively imagined narrative of the future.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Josh Thorson

artisticAlley.name: Signatures Art and Literary Magazine
artisticAlley.description: Signatures is RIT's award-winning undergraduate art and literary magazine. At Imagine RIT, we will be passing out free copies of our new issue, Issue 32, which contains poetry, prose, and art from RIT students. Throughout the day, we will also have poetry and prose readings from our contributors.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Robert Glick, Daniele DiPasquale

artisticAlley.name: Smiles Per Hour: A Happiness Experiment
artisticAlley.description: Smiles Per Hour is a happiness experiment. We are asking RIT's community 'How happy are you?' In the weeks leading up to Imagine RIT, this data is gathered via interactive kiosks in three specific locations across campus. The results of the experiment will be displayed in an engaging art installation on the day of the festival where guests can learn about what affects happiness.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Kat de la Fuente, Tim Torres, Casey Gilbert, Benjamin Cheng, Daniel Martin, Meshach Galley

artisticAlley.name: Spherical Video
artisticAlley.description: We are demonstrating our experiments in spherical video display. Due to the prevalence of technologies like virtual reality, the motion picture industry is currently experiencing a surge in technologies for non-standard viewing. The SMPTE student chapter is experimenting with sphere shaped displays that give a new perspective to viewers experiencing 360 degree video content. Additionally, various other projects from students in the Motion Picture Science program are being exhibited.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Noah Kram

artisticAlley.name: Sun Screen Station
artisticAlley.description: May is skin cancer awareness month! We will be provide free sunscreen for people to use at the table, tips on how to stay safe in the sun, and bracelets for children to make that tell them when they have been in the sun too long.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Emily Hunt, Ashley Kittell, Alex Pfadenhauer, Samantha Spencer, Paige Glickman, Emily Henderson, Jules Blackburn-Baskin

artisticAlley.name: The (anti)Struggle Bus
artisticAlley.description: Tiny homes are the next big housing trend, just hook up your truck to your house and go! But what if you could just hop in the drivers seat of your house and go? This isn't your average RV, it's a 1986 International School Bus that we're converting into our full time home, so come check out our 5 speed house!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Melissa Schmidt, Derek Roche, Matthew Gibson

artisticAlley.name: The Culture Corner
artisticAlley.description: The Culture Corner is an interactive exhibit with multiple stations that help bring cultural awareness to RIT Students and the greater Rochester community. We aim to foster international human empathy and connection through interactive modules, activities, and projection stations.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Adam Schechter, Jessica Cook, Crystal Follansbee, Leah Kotas, Alaina Ylitalo

artisticAlley.name: The Econeer
artisticAlley.description: The Econeer is a virtual reality experience that challenges you with creating a sustainable world. Collaborate or go head to head with players working to sculpt their ideal world in this evolving experience. Does slow and careful expansion suite you or are you the type to build lavish communities at whatever cost? Come and check it out at our booth!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Noah Greene, Andrew King, Andrew Schoolnick, Amanda Farrington, Anthony Huff, Emily Himmelwright, Rebecca Searns

artisticAlley.name: Tiny Living Experience
artisticAlley.description: Come experience a variety of tiny houses! From hand made mini models to 3D digital walk-throughs, you can touch, see and surround yourself with a tiny home. Whether it's just for you, or you and your partner or even your whole family, come see how a tiny home can be a good or bad fit for you. Let the Interior Design Club open your mind to smaller living!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Octavia Spelman, Alexa Boyd, Erika Edwards, Stefani Schultz, Barbara Casale, Sydney Quinlan, Christopher Beckley, Christine checho, Amber Hrabko, Brittany Nowicki, Angelina Grasso, Sarah Bottini, Marlee Vlassis, Taylor Thormahlen, Morgan LaRocca, Heidi Schlegel, Mary Golden, Jordanae Smith, Gabrielle Marra, Caitlyn Litaker, Kiasia Singletary, Sidney Ponikau, Felicia Boria, Sirivalynn Thavone, Amy Van DeWater, Sarah Ingraham, Sam Destremps

artisticAlley.name: Ultra-Hi-Res Data Capture for 3D Imaging
artisticAlley.description: Using photographic processes to gather high-resolution data for use in the production of realistic 3D models and textures.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Martin Pietras, David Halbstein, Brenden Toyoshima

artisticAlley.name: VENU
artisticAlley.description: Venu is a wayfinding app for Imagine RIT that recommends exhibits and events based on your interests and preferences. Our team members will be around to talk about Venu and the process we went through to create it. We'll also be able to provide demos and technical support if needed. Come stop by and say hello!
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Jeffwaslin Dinh, Melanie Kim, Julia Bender, Erick Sauri, Isaac Selleck, Jenna Ammerall, Jamus Andrest

artisticAlley.name: Video Demonstration - 3D Digital Design Process
artisticAlley.description: This exhibit will be a time lapse video demonstration of the 3D digital design process from design to completion of a 3D shot.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Alejandro Pérez Sánchez, Veenal Roland D'silva

artisticAlley.name: Vignelli Insight
artisticAlley.description: Our exhibit will be highly interactive: Visitors will be able to walk through the 'Design: Vignelli' exhibit in the Vignelli Center with provided tablets linking them to information such as process work, sketches, fun facts, and more, that will allow the curation of their own experiences.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Daniele DiPasquale, Andy Charlot, Emili Koui, Patti Axford, Jeff Lee, Christine Heusner, Kaitlyn Pielechowski, Markus Hines, Kat Zic

artisticAlley.name: Virtual Arcade
artisticAlley.description: The games showcased in this activity are designed by RIT students. Student work pushes creative, interactive and visual limits of the various 2D and 3D Game Genres. The tool-sets the students use for these projects allow an almost unlimited creative amount of design opportunities. Graphics from realistic to cartoon, interaction both comical and random to highly realistic physics based simulations are used to build interactive 2D/3D worlds.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Shaun Foster, Marla Schweppe, Kevin Crompwell, Victoria Lake, John Satriale, Dan Aran, Peter Lockhart, Elizabeth Stevens, Sydney Yoshioka, Sitong Chen, Lauren Sebaugh, Stephanie Stoner, Ryan Jeter

artisticAlley.name: Visual Media Innovation Project
artisticAlley.description: Students in the Visual Media Innovation Project class exhibit a variety of unique visual communication experiences using existing and emerging photographic and media technologies. Included will be such diverse things as 3D print from small scale drone photogrammetry, digital book fore-edge decorative printing, photographs that transform into paintings, flip books that transform into animated projections, 3d folding portraiture, and a sustainable fashion shoot.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Frank Cost, Qiwei Chen, Marcus Eisendorf, Ryan Flanagan, Monica Gustin , Elizabeth Haltiner, Elisabeth Hughes, Meghan Marin, Alexandra McClintock

artisticAlley.name: We Knit This City - Hooks and Needles Club
artisticAlley.description: We Knit This City is a project that is improved on every year by the members of RIT's Hooks and Needles Club (RIT's knitting, crocheting, and fiber arts club). We have created a knit model of campus that allows for some fun photography opportunities. We also have created enough knit/ crochet bricks to 'yarn bomb' one of the concrete walls on campus. We also run a fun finger knitting craft activity for children of all ages (recommended for children 6+)
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Elizabeth DoVale, Felix Brink, Mirjam Makovec, Theresa Klingshirn, Cathryne Szczepanik, Olivia Phillips, Xiaoshan Lin, Kate Quesada

artisticAlley.name: Women of Rochester Dress
artisticAlley.description: This dress displays examples of printing on fabric. The design of the dress incorporates famous women from the Rochester area. The dress fabric lists the names of over 100 women from Rochester and displays special panels for several of the more well-known examples. The fabric is a Dupion silk and the panels incorporate a variety of inks, some electronics, and other details. The dress is a celebration of the 100th anniversary of women receiving the right to vote in New York.
artisticAlley.exhibitors: Marla Schweppe, Shu Chang, Christine Heusner, Nuchjarin Pareeratanasomporn, Gail Argetsinger, Chandramohan Seetharamiah Srinibasaraju

businessDistrict.name: 3D Printing: Bringing Your 2D Memories to Life
businessDistrict.description: Want to know more about 3D printing? Want to know if 3D printing could be available for you to use? That's what we are examining for our MS Management capstone graduate project. We are exploring the 3D market as it stands today and evaluating if there is a cost effective solution where the average household would be able to use 3D printing technology as they desire.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Andrew Tobin, Omar Rahmaan, Maria De Filippo, Yordalis Corporan

businessDistrict.name: AR supplemental information in a Living Museum
businessDistrict.description: This exhibit uses AR (Augmented Reality) to provide supplemental information in a Living Museum and offers visitors of an engaging experience that is informative, innovative and enjoyable. This exhibit replicates the markers used in the Bergen Swamp, a New York State living museum. Visitors can use their own handheld device or use a device I provide, to view supplemental information of the various living things located at the marker.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Rita Locke Pettine, Steve Locke

businessDistrict.name: Business Is Fun: Saunders Welcome Center
businessDistrict.description: Visit the Saunders College of Business where you will find how fun business can be. Hear from our students and how they use technology to find solutions to everyday business problems. Free snow cones will be handed out!
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Lauren Heary

businessDistrict.name: Consulting for BioWorks
businessDistrict.description: Learn about the consulting process and gain insight into industries such as horticulture, agriculture, and bio-pesticides! During the spring semester, our group was involved in a consulting project with BioWorks, a local company that provides sustainable and environmentally friendly growing solutions. Our project focuses market research, competitor analysis, and recommendations on how to create a unique advantage in an increasingly competitive environment.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Meagan Kidder, Nikhil Srivastava, Sarah Baris

businessDistrict.name: Cryogenic Camera Consulting
businessDistrict.description: As a group we have been tasked to consult with Michael Zemcov about his cryogenic camera. The cryogenic camera is a camera that can work at temperatures below -100 degrees Celsius. Our job is to do market research to see if this product is something worth investing in.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Michael Bowen, Simona Blackshear, Gavin Markman, Natalie Flansburg

businessDistrict.name: Designing for Differences
businessDistrict.description: We are developing a business model and plan focused on product development, design and manufacturing operations and marketing and sales strategies for the promotion of the product. The business will address the needs of the designers, artists and those with disabilities in producing "design differences" furniture for our target market.. Each piece of furniture will be designed by the artist, created by people with disabilities and custom tagged to tell a story to the customer. Each design and piece of furniture will have unique attributes due to the contributions of the individuals involved in the manufacturing process as well as the sustainable materials used.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Susan Hansen, Patrick Reynolds, Llesy Alcantara, Ray Zayas, Silvia Caraballo

businessDistrict.name: Fleecimals: A Student's Stuffed Animal Busines
businessDistrict.description: My small business surrounding cute octopus stuffed animals. Some are just for fun, but others are useful. I have stingrays that are screen cleaners and an octopus that is both a heat and ice pack! We do custom orders too. Come check us out!
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Michelle Vullo, Noah Janis, Sarah Baris

businessDistrict.name: Fun with Sphero
businessDistrict.description: Sphero is a fun toy that gives everyone an opportunity to learn how to problem solve using programming all while having fun. Our exhibit is intended to introduce problem solving, programming, and robotics to kids of all ages.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Dave Ballard, Jaykumar Sharma, Jacob Dittenhauser, Kevin Lozano, Shruti Patel, Matt Arlauckas

businessDistrict.name: Giant Rochester Monopoly
businessDistrict.description: Join us for life sized Monopoly! Win candy and prizes. This event is sponsored by the members of the Epsilon Lambda chapter of Delta Sigma Pi.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Andrew Greene, Adnan Syed, Alexandra Myers, Shikhar Chawla, Jules Blackburn-Baskin, Tik Ho (Andy) Chan, Kyrie Ciricillo, Salvatore Fabozzi, Edwin Jensen , MacKenzie Thomson , Elisabeth Vosburgh, Paige Glickman, Justin Batra, Alana Bichutsky, Peter Bilzerian, Rachel Ferrara, Jackson Wikstrom, Sam Liang, Manuel Acosta, Peggy Tirrell, Sean Hansen, Kathleen Hagelberger, Amelia Sykes, Ieva Backute, Pranesh Das Purandaradoss, Valeria Martinez, Adit Shetty, Austin Obiora

businessDistrict.name: Global Business Group
businessDistrict.description: Poster display to show networking and diversity.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Lauren Heary, Gurpreet Kaur

businessDistrict.name: Link By Link
businessDistrict.description: We are a team of students challenging the narrative associated with extreme terrorism in our country. Many people are treated unequally in America because of their religion or ethnicity being associated with negative, terrorist stereotypes. Our goal is to show that regardless of race and religion, we're not all that different. We are re-shaping the narrative- link by link.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Teodora Toteva, Luciana Vianna, Abigail Van Nostrand, Fazila Kanchwala

businessDistrict.name: Managing a Project for Camp Good Days
businessDistrict.description: See project management in action! We are completing a fundraising event for Camp Good Days and we want to show you what the donation will help the children effected by cancer experience at camp!
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Rebecca Fultz, Pamela Hernandez, Dakota Clay

businessDistrict.name: Nerf Jeopardy
businessDistrict.description: Like Jeopardy? Enjoy shooting Nerf toys? Then this exhibit is for you. Stop by Saunders College of Business and play business Jeopardy. Determine the category which you will participate by hitting the Jeopardy board. Raffle prizes by the end of the day to participants who answered correct!
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Dave Ballard

businessDistrict.name: RIT Theater Program
businessDistrict.description: Does RIT need a Black Box Theater? We will explore this question and if the answer is yes, we will discuss possible locations, as well as costs and possible marketing strategies for such a theater.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Taurance Robnett, Ty Clauss, Jeff Kosakowski, Dakota Clay

businessDistrict.name: Snow Cones
businessDistrict.description: Visit the Saunders College of Business for a free snow cone!
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Lauren Heary

businessDistrict.name: TEDxRIT
businessDistrict.description: TEDxRIT showcases the ideas that RIT students chose. We will be highlighting our clubs vision, our event(s) and our goal of serving the local community, organized and plans solely by students.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Theodore Johnston

businessDistrict.name: The Kracauer Experiment: A Study in A/V Synthesis
businessDistrict.description: Synthesthesia. Psychoacoustics. Movement. Immerse yourself in the mind altering world of Audio / Visual Synthesis. The Kracauer experiment melds Rochester's fattest grooves with interactive multimedia in our pop-up lab. Your mind and body will slip into an altered state while synthesized waves and light rays pour into your consciousness. This collaboration between Wicked Squid Studios, The Empire Film Music Ensemble, and Floated Magazine will be a multimedia experience you won't wanna miss.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Jonathan Kruger, Ben Escobar, Josh Pettinger

businessDistrict.name: USA-Croatia Exchange Program
businessDistrict.description: USA-Croatia Global Exchange gives students of International Business program the opportunity to partake in a unique cultural exchange program, joining a cohort of students consisting of RIT Rochester and RIT Croatia campuses. Students embark on a one semester journey, starting the semester in Croatia for a span of six weeks after which students will be travelling to Rochester to complete two more accelerated courses and participate in multiple field trips around Rochester. The exhibit will be a presentation created by the cohort of students from both the USA and Croatia.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Lauren Heary

businessDistrict.name: Vantage News
businessDistrict.description: Vantage News is a one of a kind mobile application for the news obsessed. To become truly informed, one article isn't enough. Alternative perspectives, historical context, and related stories are critical to getting the big picture. Vantage's framing feature is the news junkie's gateway not just to knowledge, but also to understanding.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Ty Clauss, Michael Shullick, Pablo Ordorica

businessDistrict.name: VENU Information Booth
businessDistrict.description: Venu is a wayfinding app for Imagine RIT that recommends exhibits and events at the festival based on your interests and preferences. At this information booth, we'll introduce you to the app and provide technical support if needed. If you don't already have Venu, we'll have devices with Venu loaded for you to use as a demo, as well as monitors showing live data from the Venu app. Venu is a senior project created by students in the New Media Design BFA and New Media Interactive Development BS programs at RIT. Our team members will be located at a second booth location in the James E. Booth building, so stop by and say hello!
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Jeffwaslin Dinh, Jenna Ammerall

businessDistrict.name: YEA: Saunders Scholars WINNER
businessDistrict.description: The Young Entrepreneurs Academy (YEA!) Saunders Scholars Competition brings together the top student businesses from each YEA! class around the country to compete to win scholarship dollars, and business start-up prize packages. The WINNER of the competition will be showing their business plan at Imagine RIT.
businessDistrict.exhibitors: Lauren Heary

computerZone.name: 2017 Graduate Capstone Gallery
computerZone.description: 3 Games - PrincessCape A puzzle platformer where the princess decides she can save herself. Princess Elwynn finds the power of a magical cape, speedy boots, magnetic gloves and herself. - Gloom Box Use music to alter the world and solve puzzles. Mash up music to discover new abilities. - Y.A.W. (Yet Another World) A V.R. simulation of a planetoid that responds to your exploration. Discover creatures and features as the world comes to life.
computerZone.exhibitors: Elouise Oyzon, Arun Krishnakumar, Jeffery Kelly, Anthony Zalar, Chen Yang, Reuben Brenner-Adams, Stein Astor Fernandez

computerZone.name: Al Biles & GenJam
computerZone.description: Al Biles (a human trumpet player) & GenJam (the Genetic Jammer) play straight up jazz. They improvise on all kinds of tunes, and carry on a musical conversation, just like all good jazz soloists. GenJam, however, is software that evolves its musical ideas in real time as it listens to Al. Their repertoire includes Miles, Monk, Messengers, mambo, mainstream, modern, movie music, and more! Stop by to listen. Bring your ax and sit in! Watch Al's and GenJam's notes float by on the big screen!!
computerZone.exhibitors: Al Biles

computerZone.name: Algorave: Creating Dance Music with Code
computerZone.description: Live coding is an experimental performance practice where musicians/coders create music by coding it in front of an audience. The generated source code is projected for audience members to see. An Algorave is to the live coder what a rave is for a DJ; an event held at a club where live coders take turns performing one after another creating algorithmic dance music by coding it.
computerZone.exhibitors: Charles Roberts

computerZone.name: Analog Student Games Showcase
computerZone.description: Check out the analog games designed by students and faculty in the IGM program. Participate in hands-on demos and discussions on prototyping and development of tabletop and board games.
computerZone.exhibitors: Sean Boyle, Ryan Muskopf, David Erbelding, Reuben Brenner-Adams, Michael Howlett, Brandon Rodriguez, Collin Zanche, Connor Cummings

computerZone.name: Augmented Reality Chess Game
computerZone.description: Play a game of augmented reality chess game with friends not present at the same physical location as you are.
computerZone.exhibitors: Niyati Shah, Tanvi Raut

computerZone.name: Automatic Sentry Turret
computerZone.description: Demonstration of a Automatic Sentry Turret which is used to for securing an area against unauthorized people.
computerZone.exhibitors: Nicholas Freville

computerZone.name: Big Top - A Four Player Circus Game
computerZone.description: Big Top is a four player drafting and crafting card game about creating showpieces for the circus so that you can claim the title of Entertainer Extraordinaire.
computerZone.exhibitors: Oliver Barnum, Chase Slatterly, Matt Sahlin

computerZone.name: Blackfeather
computerZone.description: A video game where players take the role of a parrot who can control any pirate it perches upon. The parrot's goal is simple, find a way to keep a treasure to itself.
computerZone.exhibitors: Jessica Bayliss, David Chang, Kevin Idzik, Josh Malmquist, Sachit Puri, Joel Shuart, Charles Williams, Gregory Kriesel, Marla Schweppe

computerZone.name: BRICK: A Game of Networking and Subterfuge
computerZone.description: Nearables is aiming to make laser phone tag cheap and easy to set up for laser tag enthusiast of all types combined with a solid game design to bring everyone's favorite game modes.
computerZone.exhibitors: Alexia Bernardo, Matthew Crocco, Eileen Tea, Sameen Luo, Nicole Lopez

computerZone.name: Circular Gallifreyan Workshop
computerZone.description: We will be teaching people how to do Circular Gallifreyan, which is a fictional language based on the show Doctor Who. This activity is focused on teaching kids primarily but is open to all ages. There will be lots of pieces of paper and pencils for people to practice on.
computerZone.exhibitors: Claire Noble, Cameron Bajus, Taylor Braun, Derek Witt, Ava Enoch, Kyle Flores, Akash Eldo

computerZone.name: Computational Thinking with Life-Size Mazes
computerZone.description: Did you realize that when you solve a maze or other puzzle, you are thinking like a computer? Any series of steps taken to solve a problem is an algorithm, whether it is a human algorithm or a computer algorithm! In our exhibit, you will have the chance to solve some life-size mazes by walking around, and we will have other puzzles to solve as well. We will also discuss our related research in which we use puzzles as a way to teach computational thinking at RIT.
computerZone.exhibitors: Zack Butler, Ivona Bezakova, Eero Kelly, Misha Belisle, Liz Lucas, Alex Hoover, Samantha Oxley, Dana Adylova, Angelina Davern, Zack Fitzsimmons, David Narvaez, Stefan Aleksic

computerZone.name: Computing in Language Science Classrooms with Linguine
computerZone.description: Demonstration of how RIT language science coursework uses computational tools with visualizations for exploring linguistic concepts and data analysis.
computerZone.exhibitors: Cecilia O. Alm, Emily Prud'hommeaux

computerZone.name: Cosplay Troupe's Mini-Cosplay Experience
computerZone.description: Cosplay is quickly becoming a recognized term. Think of it as Halloween dressing up whenever you feel like. This activity is catered towards children, but anyone can participate. There will be materials, supplies, and several experienced cosplayers that will help you dress up and look like your favorite characters using limited supplies. You don't need a lot of cosplay. There will be a photo booth setup where you can take your photo afterwards with your finished creation.
computerZone.exhibitors: Joseph Oh, Erin McAnany, Andrew Iacovino, Ying Sin Gladys Leung, Du Giang

computerZone.name: Covert Channels in Cryptocurrency Protocols
computerZone.description: Exhibit will display research that has been done in identifying and documenting covert channels which exist as part of the Bitcoin cryptocurrency protocol, as well as comparing and contrasting other protocols to Bitcoin through the lens of suitability as a means for transmitting covert data.
computerZone.exhibitors: Alex Hew, Daryl Johnson

computerZone.name: Electro-Luminescent Organ (ELO)
computerZone.description: A restored and revamped vintage home organ, complete with a lightshow.
computerZone.exhibitors: Zachary Hart

computerZone.name: Elements
computerZone.description: A VR turn-based game using the HTC Vive where players explore a hex world and combat enemies.
computerZone.exhibitors: Jessica Bayliss, Feitong Chen, Sitong Chen, Reina Helms, Andrew Schoolnick, Lauren Sebaugh, Daniel Timko, Zach Welch, Marla Schweppe

computerZone.name: Event Analysis of Public Government Pentest Logs
computerZone.description: Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) has released to the public a data set of a penetration test performed on its corporate, internal computer network. There are 5 data sources containing 58 days worth of de-identified data. The dataset is unique because it shows a US Federal Government facility being attacked by a Red Team. [2] Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana (ELK), Splunk, and IBM's QRadar which will be explored, architected, deployed, and compared by analyzing the same LANL dataset.
computerZone.exhibitors: Scott Chapman

computerZone.name: EVF - Bring Vulnerabilities to the Classroom
computerZone.description: Come join us in Golisano Room 1469!
computerZone.exhibitors: Daryl Johnson, Corinne Smith, Michael Zobel, Bill Stackpole

computerZone.name: Experiments in Virtual Reality Game Design
computerZone.description: A showcase of several Virtual Reality experiences, each exploring a new mechanic or design pattern made possible by current VR technology.
computerZone.exhibitors: Bennett Samuels, Satchi Davis, Yanting Cheung, Ian Schreiber, Matthew Pressman

computerZone.name: Graphful : Art through code
computerZone.description: Art and science don't have to be different. Through the use of a new data language, any creative individual can leave an artistic expression.
computerZone.exhibitors: Nikhil Verma

computerZone.name: How Can Technology Empower Everyone?
computerZone.description: The main objective of this exhibit is to raise awareness of software accessibility. Accessibility is about enabling people of all abilities to have equal access to information needed for work and life. In this exhibit, attendees will interact with a mobile app that simulates the experience of users with visual impairment. This helps attendees develop a real empathy for users and a deeper understanding of how physical, cognitive and situational disabilities affect daily life activities.
computerZone.exhibitors: Yasmine Elglaly, Anthony Peruma, Scott Hawker, Stephen Cioffi

computerZone.name: Investigating Android M Permissions
computerZone.description: Android apps operate under a permission-based system where an app requires specific permissions to carry out specific functionality. In Android's new permission model (Android 'M'), users are no longer expected to confirm or deny all requested permissions upon installation of the application. The app may now prompt users during runtime for permissions as they are needed. This allows users to confirm or deny specific permission requests, but still be able to use the app. However, these profound changes lead to some challenging questions, one of which is if users feel more comfortable with this new permission model, or if it will lead to further confusion and concerns over the app's requested permissions?
computerZone.exhibitors: Daniel Krutz

computerZone.name: Jerusalem VR Experience
computerZone.description: Visit Jerusalem in the 1900's! At our booth we provide a unique virtual reality experience where users can view stereographs from the 1900's via Google Cardboard.
computerZone.exhibitors: Jacob Westerback, Chris Littlefield, Jeremy Astolfi, Ryan Flanagan, James Sasson, Stephen Jacobs, Matt Dieselman

computerZone.name: Kill the Streamer
computerZone.description: Kill the Streamer is a game between a streamer on Twitch, and their viewers talking in chat. Spawn enemies by messaging commands on Twitch. Try to work together to destroy your opponent-- the person streaming the game. You can play at twitch.tv/killthestreamergame, from any computer or even your phone! If you're the kind of player who wants a challenge, then come to our exhibit and play the game on our computer. See how long you can last against the horde!
computerZone.exhibitors: Luna Meier, Rochelle Cohn, Daniel Lowery, Rebecca Wengert, Ryan Jones, Luke Zetterlund

computerZone.name: Off the Wall
computerZone.description: Join us in room 1460 in Golisano!
computerZone.exhibitors: Ian Schreiber

computerZone.name: Pachink-Off - A Head to Head Gambling Game
computerZone.description: Do you love the head to head competitive rush of a fighting game? Do you love the thrill of gambling? Get ready to enter the exciting world of Pachink-Off! Pachink-Off is a mobile slots game, but no money is involved; the only goal is to get more tokens than your opponent! Go head to head with another player as unique and wacky characters as you engage in a fast paced gambling duel!
computerZone.exhibitors: Joel Tom, Michael Cohen

computerZone.name: Practical Ransomware Detection
computerZone.description: Presentation of a tool used to detect encrypting malware - known as Ransomware - through the use of system and process based information.
computerZone.exhibitors: Christopher Lazarus, Kyle Klatt

computerZone.name: Project Betrayal
computerZone.description: Project Betrayal is a 3D escape adventure where players progress through a building room by room solving puzzles in order to find out what happened.
computerZone.exhibitors: Jessica Bayliss, Hajime Agresta, Connor Chauncey, Ryan Jeter, Jacob Recoon, Stephanie Stoner, Trevor Walden, Yuchen Zhong, Marla Schweppe

computerZone.name: Raspberry Pi Arcade Table
computerZone.description: The Raspberry Pi Arcade Table Project is a mini arcade table using a Raspberry Pi and using Retro Pi. Children are free to play the games on the device with joysticks.
computerZone.exhibitors: Alexia Bernardo, David Quach, Lauren DiDonato, William Krodthoff, Makaya Hicks

computerZone.name: RITficial Intelligence
computerZone.description: Join us for RITficial Intelligence in Golisano room 1465.
computerZone.exhibitors: Dylan Bowald, Andy Meyer

computerZone.name: Sight: A VR Horror Experience
computerZone.description: A virtual reality horror game for the Oculus. The player's character is bound to a wheelchair and paranormal entities will show up in different situations leading to jump scares, chase scenes, etc. A hiding mechanic allows the player to hide from enemies. During gameplay, the player will have a constant feeling that something is behind them through effects such as breathing sounds, shadows, foot steps, mirror reflections, etc. A single level of the game will be playable at our exhibit.
computerZone.exhibitors: Sarathi Hansen, Jaben McCormack

computerZone.name: Society of Software Engineers Projects
computerZone.description: The Society of Software Engineers is proud to present a showcase of our projects from the most recent school year. Exhibits are both interactive and informative, with project creators available to answer questions. Projects include an interactive sandbox, remotely controlled jukebox computer, and various web-based projects. Feel free to ask in-depth technical questions and to play with the exhibit.
computerZone.exhibitors: Robert McLaughlin, Christina Howard, Michael Timbrook, Stephen Cioffi, Kevin Hannigan, Daniel Gude, Michael Longley, Kayla Davis, Joseph De Simpliciis, Benjamin Alderfer, Dylan Vuz, Kevin Arnett, Bill Dybas, Javis Johnson, Curtis Shea

computerZone.name: taskIt
computerZone.description: taskIt is simple and intuitive productivity app which helps to organize your life. You can add your tasks, both standalone or in the form of events, which group several tasks. taskIt enables you to sync events between your friends so that you can collectively be productive!
computerZone.exhibitors: Mitchell Sweet

computerZone.name: Team Based Fighting Game - Chosen Fate
computerZone.description: Our game Chosen Fate is a team based platform fighter. Players will choose from a number of weapons, armor, fighting styles, and special techniques to create their own personalized character. They then head into battle, either online or in local play. Contenders will work together to secure the enemy team's flag, and take down anyone who stands in their way!
computerZone.exhibitors: D'yangelo Grullon, Antwan Russell, Trinh Le, Nicholas Barlow

computerZone.name: Undergraduate Research in Computational Sensing
computerZone.description: This exhibit will disseminate information about the interdisciplinary REU Program in Computational Sensing. Visitors may experience sensing devices, posters, materials about the site (flyers, applications, information materials).
computerZone.exhibitors: Cecilia O. Alm, Reynold Bailey

computerZone.name: VRoom - A VR Car Combat Game
computerZone.description: VRoom is a VR car combat game built for the HTC Vive. It uses 3D motion tracking to seat the players in a digital car, allowing them to experience a high-speed chase against an AI opponent. Visitors will be able to try out the VR experience, attempting to destroy their pursuer without losing their own car. Using the Vive, they'll get a seat behind the steering wheel and right into the action. Drive through the wasteland and destroy your pursuers in a quick, self-contained experience.
computerZone.exhibitors: Robert Bailey, Aidan Markham, Alia Gestl, Jeannette Forbes, John Fediaczko, John Palermo, Luke Hedrick, Noah Kellem, Elouise Oyzon

computerZone.name: WiC Networking Alumni App
computerZone.description: We are currently trying to create a WiC Alumni Networking app using React Native and the Realm database. The aim of the app is to be able to move some of the communication from our closed Facebook Group to the mobile app. This app will allow WiC members to interact with others with this platform.
computerZone.exhibitors: Alexia Bernardo, Regina Locicero, Abigail Tran, David Quach

engineeringPark.name: 3D-Printed Puzzles
engineeringPark.description: Various interactive puzzles that were designed in AutoCAD and printed using 3D Printers.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Scott Williamson, Liam Callahan, Mia Sitzler, Hannah Van Fleet, Daniel Yochim, David Wilson, Michael Smith, Alexa Kline, Kaleigh Marcotte.

engineeringPark.name: A Navy Frigate: Heat Exchanger Demo
engineeringPark.description: This interactive exhibit explores the functioning of a heat exchanger from a Navy frigate! This hands-on demonstration allows visitors to learn about the principles of heat exchange both in theory and through their senses. Color-coded hoses and color changing film makes the experience fun for all ages!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Sarah Kirk

engineeringPark.name: ABVI Upcycling: Cotton Insulation
engineeringPark.description: Our goal for this project is to produce a prototype of a insulation made from recycled cotton, such that the customer (Goodwill) will be able to manufacture this product and then make a profit from selling the recycled textiles. The benefit of this product is that it is environmentally friendly, the product can be touched with bare hands and performs equally to that as standard fiberglass insulation.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Mitchell Goepel, Samantha Kon

engineeringPark.name: Active Noise Cancellation
engineeringPark.description: Our group has designed an active noise cancellation system consisting of microphone/speaker pairs and processing software powered by the Strength Pareto Evolutionary Algorithm (SPEA2). The goals of this project are to reduce the overall noise of the work environment within the bandwidth of the average human hearing capabilities in real time with minimal adjustments from the user. Ultimately, this software will be expanded to network with other machines to cancel noise in an entire office.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Matthew Gibson, Vincent Coffey, Nick Venditti

engineeringPark.name: Advanced Gear Manufacturing with Gleason Works
engineeringPark.description: This exhibit is presenting the advanced gear manufacturing processes with a demonstration about how to use the gear hobbing machine to operate gear cutting. Besides that, a presentation about how to operate the gear hobbing analysis to improve the efficiency and the product quality also will be provided to the viewers
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Rui Liu, Eloy Yague-Martinez

engineeringPark.name: Aero Design
engineeringPark.description: The RIT Aero-Design team will have a wind-tunnel demonstration on display. The team will also have their competition aircraft from the 2016-17 AIAA Design Build Fly competition on display as well as other aircraft that were constructed in previous years.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Ian Lengel, Brady Hrabovsky, Robert Morandini, Max Messie, Kyle Prosser, Drew Flickinger

engineeringPark.name: American Institute of Chemical Engineers
engineeringPark.description: Learn about surface tension and check out RC size cars that start and stop on a chemical reaction.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Ashley Bloomfield, Eric Kolb, Dennis Bogdan, Josh Clark, Orianna Henry, Ryan Mazur, Heather Ursino, Ioan Gitsov, Valerie Burger, Maura Sepesy, William Mohr, Matt Bauer, Andrew Fleischer, Quintina Frink, Patricia Valenzuela, Taylor Smith, Melissa Rockhill, Donald Lord

engineeringPark.name: AMPrint Center - Multifunctional 3D Printing
engineeringPark.description: The AMPrint Center is NY State's newest Center for Advanced Technology, and is devoted to Additive Manufacturing and Multifunctional Printing. The Center has 20 different printers, and a variety of associated equipment. Many different kinds of materials can be printed here, including polymers, metals, ceramics, and composites. See demonstrations of many different types of printing processes in action, and take home a souvenir!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Bruce Kahn, Robert Ichiyama, Mark Irving, Susan Rausch, Bill Murray, Khushbu Zope, Denis Cormier, Jessica Jaroszewski, Amy Kahn, Max Kahn, Sally Kahn, Casey Cephas

engineeringPark.name: Automated Player Piano for Handicap Accessibility
engineeringPark.description: A piano designed around the needs for handicapped individuals will be playing music autonomously with and without human musicians playing along with it.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Scott Porter, Matthew Mack , Ben Parnas

engineeringPark.name: Biochar Concrete Roofing Sheets for Nicaragua
engineeringPark.description: Light weight concrete roofing tiles were made for a local non-profit organization called 4 Walls. 4 Walls provides homes to the people of El Sauce Nicaragua. The goal of the project was to replace the current metal roof that could be manufactured locally, at low cost, and prevent rain water from entering the house, as well as animals from nesting in the roof. The group worked to achieve this goal by using concrete and the light weight aggregate of biochar.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Mary Korycansky, Jenn Kane, Luqman Zainalabidin, Rory Little, Carmen Azzaretti

engineeringPark.name: Biomechanical Elbow Model
engineeringPark.description: The objective of this project is to create a physical model that can demonstrate the proper relationship between the position of the hand/wrist and the different muscles.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Amanda Cook, Maria Romero-Creel, Shannon Keenan, Chris Harley

engineeringPark.name: Cat Cart: A Feline Mobility Assistive
engineeringPark.description: Some of our furry friends need a bit more help than others. This was the case for two local cats born with some degree of paralysis in their rear legs. Our senior design project was granted the task of creating a cart for each cat to improve their mobility and quality of life. The carts are a low cost and do-it-yourself initiative whose designs may be freely distributed to help disabled cats everywhere. Stop by our exhibit to see our clients, Trey and Delilah, in action using their carts!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Sarah Stoltzfus, Jeff Wayman, Matthieu Dora, Colin Lemen, Ed Hanzlik, Karla Weller-Barkley

engineeringPark.name: Compression Cycle Simulation Test Rig
engineeringPark.description: Our custom test rig simulates the compression cycle created by a large piston compressor. The air pressure cycle is created through the use of compressed air, computer-controlled valves, and a custom built pressure tank. Inside the pressure vessel is a section of poppet valves that open and close allowing the pressure cycle to occur. The objective of this test rig is to measure the vibrations of these poppet valves in order to detect different types of failures associated with the poppet valves.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Brandon Chrysler, Alex Grassl, Ryan Muchard, Carvey Yung

engineeringPark.name: Continuous Classroom Vermicomposter
engineeringPark.description: The continuous classroom vermicomposter is a system for the treatment of food wastes using rapid composting. A colony of earthworms are used to assist in breaking down compost into rich condensed soil that can be used in farming and producing organic plant fertilizer.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Erik Freeman, Niall O'Dowd, Jay Patel

engineeringPark.name: Continuous System for Fly Larvae Composting
engineeringPark.description: This system enables facilities to efficiently compost more waste with a smaller footprint, eliminating the environmental effects of hauling waste to landfills and bio-digester facilities. It is easy to clean, allowing larvae to migrate for harvesting, and allows flies to lay eggs. This is suitable in climates that are not naturally suited for BSFL.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Erinne Munie, Ryan Hochreiter, Taylor Hogan

engineeringPark.name: ElectroPhotographic Test Bed
engineeringPark.description: 2017 Senior Design Team has upgraded an existing Electrophotographic Test Bed with a new structure to be used for experimental and research purposes.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Ankit Prasad, Brandon Miller, Stephanie Boula, Dr. Marcos Esterman, Bill Novak

engineeringPark.name: Fluids are Fun - Air Cannon
engineeringPark.description: A flow of fluid can produce a great amount of force on objects. By sealing the barrel of an Air Cannon with nerf balls and compressed air, we can generate enough force to launch the nerf balls a great distance into the air.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Tzu-Ting Hsu, Eric Pareis, Graham Ardner, Tim Landschoot

engineeringPark.name: Fluids are Fun - Bernoulli Blower
engineeringPark.description: This exhibit is an interactive demonstration of the Bernoulli principle and by relation the Bernoulli Blower. Several small scale Bernoulli Blowers are available to pick up and use. Additionally, there is a large, table mounted Bernoulli Blower that can be used to levitate beach-balls. Both types have various fittings to interact with, such as nozzles, tubes, and angled elbows.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Tzu-Ting Hsu, Jesse Fronckowiak, Devin Cooley, Adam Stock, Sushmita Shetti

engineeringPark.name: Fluids are Fun - Laminar Flow Table
engineeringPark.description: Participants place objects on a table in flowing water to see waves like the ones that cars, planes, boats, and other vehicles make as they move through the air or water.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Tzu-Ting Hsu, Patrick McGaw, Corry Straathof, Jason Liu

engineeringPark.name: Fluids are Fun - MR Fluids
engineeringPark.description: This exhibit is a demonstration of the ability of magnetorheological (MR) fluids to change viscosity by exposing the fluids to a magnetic field.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Tzu-Ting Hsu, Ignazio Scollo, Wylie McDonald, Matt Santullo

engineeringPark.name: Fluids are Fun - Oobleck
engineeringPark.description: A non-Newtonian fluid is one in which the rate of strain is not linearly proportional to the rate of shear stress. A shear thickening, or dilatant, fluid becomes more viscous, or resistant to flow, as more shear stress is applied. This happens when long, branchy molecules, like starch, get tangled as they move quickly past each other and act like a solid. However, when moving slow, the molecules are able to pass by each other, and act like a liquid.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Tzu-Ting Hsu, Kenny Hass, Hyungsuk Kang

engineeringPark.name: Fluids are Fun - Slow Motion Water Balloons
engineeringPark.description: This exhibit requires two participants: one to get soaked and one to do the soaking! The first person sits below a bucket holding a water balloon. The second person presses a button, which releases the water balloon and records the action in super slow motion! You can view your movie immediately on the monitor and later on YouTube!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Tzu-Ting Hsu, Mary Young, Kayle Pitts

engineeringPark.name: FSAE Composite Tube Winder
engineeringPark.description: Over the past year, our team has designed, manufactured and tested a filament winding machine capable of producing carbon fiber drive shafts and other cylindrical composite parts for the Formula SAE team. The machine is programmable using an easy to use graphical interface that allows for rapid changes to part geometry on the fly. This project highlights the growing trend that automated manufacturing can now be implemented on a very low budget yet still produce high quality components.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Andrew Derhammer, Daniel Wu, Matt Hendler, Jon Washington

engineeringPark.name: Global Coordinated Vaccine Pricing Evaluation
engineeringPark.description: This exhibit will present the experimental results of running a mathematical model that determines the prices of bundles of vaccines for different markets. This exhibit will present the experimental results of running a mathematical model that determines the prices of bundles of vaccines for different markets and what happens when markets decrease their vaccine budget.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Jose Batista Abikarram

engineeringPark.name: Heart Pump and Circulatory System Model
engineeringPark.description: The Heart Pump and Circulatory System Model is designed to assist Biomedical Engineering students here at RIT with understanding how small changes can affect the entire circulatory system. The model shows physiological conditions such as resting, exercising, obesity, and high blood pressure. The students can change parameters then observe how the heart pressure, capillary pressure, and flow rate adapt in the system.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Susan Rhodes, Kevan Bjornson

engineeringPark.name: Heat Transfer and Magnetism
engineeringPark.description: A demonstration using color-changing film and magnets to display the material properties of common metals that cannot be seen with the eye alone. Visitors will be encouraged to explore this hands-on exhibit and "see" for themselves the connection between thermal (heat) and electrical conductivity.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Heather Cottone, Sarah Kirk, Rachael Stroebel, Breanna Jewell

engineeringPark.name: High Altitude Balloon Instrumentation Platform
engineeringPark.description: The goal of this project is to combine communication and image/data collection technologies into a unified platform that can observe near-space environments. The system will acquire telemetry information and sensor data. Data and a live analog video stream will be transmitted to Earth. Captured sensor data and HD video will also be stored to on-board SD cards. A reaction wheel assembly was designed and implemented to stabilize the instrumentation platform about one axis.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Adam Steenkamer, Steven Giewont, Connor Goldberg, Ian Prechtl, Lincoln Glauser, Matthew Zachary, Christopher Schwab, Sydney Kaminski, Dorin Patru

engineeringPark.name: Interactive Thermal Management
engineeringPark.description: Fundamental research of boiling heat transfer will be the focus of the exhibit. Visitors will be able to understand the different ways we use liquids to cool electronics. Visitors will also discover how research in TAMFL is being conducted to overcome many different thermal management issues. Specifically, visitors will be able to see live demonstrations of the in-house developed experimental setups and understand how boiling liquid is used for cooling applications.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Alyssa Recinella, Aranya Chauhan, Arvind Jaikumar, Austin Hayes, Indranil Joshi, Isaac Perez Raya, Jose Luis Gonzalez Hernandez, Pruthvik Raghupathi, Travis Emery, Satish Kandlikar

engineeringPark.name: International House VR
engineeringPark.description: Experience VR! Learn about International Culture through the lens of student life at International House! Fun AND games!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Leo Holman, Ian Effendi

engineeringPark.name: Kon-Tiki Kiln Heat Recovery System
engineeringPark.description: The goal of this project is to heat water to a safe bathing temperature, and, if the temperatures can be held consistently, to pasteurize the water. Because the kiln is used in countries where education can be minimal, operator ease and simple setup are key requirements for the recovery system. Biochar kilns also come in various sizes, so the heat reclamation system should be adaptable to those existing kilns.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Abby Higgins, Kelsey Thompsom, Leah Matczak, Thane Vollbrecht, Eta Santoro

engineeringPark.name: LORD Downhole Test Simulator Feasibility Study
engineeringPark.description: LORD Corporation designs and manufactures multiple vibration isolators for use in downhole drilling. Currently, LORD is sending their product offsite to undergo necessary testing. LORD has tasked our team to determine if an onsite testing facility that will simulate the environment that the vibration isolators would experience downhole could be feasible. Our team has been tasked with creating a feasibility study to ensure that a testing facility for LORD's vibration isolators could be feasible.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Abby Tremont, Daniel Bowers, Hyungsuk Kang, Jason Whyte, Nicholas Fewell, Samuel Zimmerman, Matthew Biron , Gary Werth

engineeringPark.name: Making Microchips and MEMS Sensors
engineeringPark.description: In this exhibit the tiny chips and sensors have dimensions of just a few hundreds of micrometers (the diameter of a human hair) but can sense many physical properties such as pressure, acceleration, humidity, temperature and light. Such sensors are used in automobiles, cell phones, rockets and people. Explore these tiny devices and see how they are made and integrated into microsystems.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Lynn Fuller, Rob Pearson, Thierno Diallo, Jackson Anderson, Adam Wardas, Patsy Cadareanu, Jenna Doran, Kelly Weiskittel, Matt Hartensveld, Jack Kong, Casey Gonta

engineeringPark.name: MAME 3.0: Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator
engineeringPark.description: Arcade Machine emulator that has been designed as a miniature arcade cabinet.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Scott Williamson, Jason Blocklove, Joseph Panaro, Christian Kobb, Luke Murphy, Kaleigh Marcotte

engineeringPark.name: Meet Your Brain
engineeringPark.description: "Meet Your Brain" Workshop presents a new model to help kids develop systems thinking skills.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Mehrafza Mirzazad Barijugh, Leah Fiorucci Combo

engineeringPark.name: MIDIV2
engineeringPark.description: People will be able to walk up to the device, which will be connected to a PC/laptop and speakers, and they'll be able to play the device to produce music, similar to a classic keyboard
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Khaled Albaddah, Matthew Wong, Graham Boylan

engineeringPark.name: MotorMouth Assistive Tablet Case
engineeringPark.description: MotorMouth is a device that helps children with non-verbal Autism do just that! Our wearable tablet case can assist children with this disorder, as well as its coupled conditions, communicate. There are even some fun textures integrated for favorable sensory stimulus. Be sure to visit MotorMouth to learn about Augmentative and Alternative Communication
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Christina Maragioglio, Elizabeth Jackson

engineeringPark.name: Ortho Clinical Blood Sample Suspension Tray
engineeringPark.description: With the help of Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, we have created a sample tray to interface with blood analyzers that keeps red blood cells in suspension. During the HbA1C blood test, lab technicians must manually shake blood samples to redistribute the red blood cells needed for the test. Our tray uses a battery powered vibration motor to keep the red blood cells suspended for the duration of the test for accurate results.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Randi del Rosario, Patrick Bayly, Lezeh Foy, Christopher Kirby, Ana Peredo

engineeringPark.name: Plastic Bottle to Rope Upcycling Machine
engineeringPark.description: Come and recycle your plastic bottles with our bottle to rope machine that cuts and weaves bottles into a very strong rope product. The weaving machine is to be deployed to developing countries, such as Haiti, where it will empower recycling efforts and generate income for local communities.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: William Hollomon , Koby Kubrin , Jordan Reynolds, Albert Lin

engineeringPark.name: Playing Hand - Cricket using Myo Arm-Band
engineeringPark.description: Hand Cricket is a game that can be played by 2 people of all age group.We decide to use the Myo-ArmBand to detect the movement of the arm and further use supervised learning to classify the movement of the arm and calculate the score and other characteristics of the game of cricket, we would make the computer do the same and then in the end announce the winner.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: KARTHIK SIVARAMA KRISHNAN, Srinath Ramachandran, Akash Saha

engineeringPark.name: RIT InMoov: 3D Printed Humanoid Robot
engineeringPark.description: We will exhibit an Inmoov robot, an open-sourced life-sized humanoid 3D-printed robot, which we used as a base model for our future goal of making a 3D-printed life-sized hand able to do American Sign Language.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Esther Septimo, Kristin Angel, sudmun habib, Joshua Hilton, Antoun Obied, George Matta, Tajbid Rahman, Jonathan Dickinson

engineeringPark.name: RIT Launch Initiative: High Powered Rocketry
engineeringPark.description: This year's Launch Initiative exhibit will involve the much-anticipated unveiling of the nine-foot-long, level two high powered rocket "Hephaestus I" and the next generation of our level three high-powered competition rocket. The Launch Initiative will also be displaying our many level one launch vehicles as well as our footage from previous flights.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Thomas Skudlarek, Zachary Rizzolo, Forrest Shooster, Oldarlyn Castillo, Andrew Mashayekhi, Eric Roth, Hunter Collins, Bailey Reid, Matthew Davern, Abhishek Shah, Zoe-Jerusha Beepat, Kyle Tevis

engineeringPark.name: RIT Observatory Upgrade
engineeringPark.description: The goal of this project is to upgrade the observatory dome at RIT to allow easier observation of stellar objects so that more time can be put into analysing collect data.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Raymond Castro, Joseph Brescia, Wilson Quizhpi, Susan Farnand, Ahmed Alhurubi, Sarah Williams

engineeringPark.name: Robocomposter: The Automation of Composting
engineeringPark.description: Composting is a technique that can be used to take food and other organic waste, a significant contributor to landfill waste, and convert it to useful fertilizer. Robocomposter is a prototype of an automated machine that can grind, transport, and accelerate the process of composting. This prototype is fully automatic and can shred down any kitchen waste and transport the waste through the composter to accelerate the composting process.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Charles Friedman, Emir Ljuca, Dante Gonzales, John Maguire

engineeringPark.name: Robot - Escape the Maze!
engineeringPark.description: Robot games, maze mapping robots, Race your robot versus an autonomous robot. Escape the maze guarded by robot sentries.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Paul Lane, Daniel Kaputa, Clark Hochgraf, Josef DeHaan, Michael McLeod, Corey Pardee, Derrick Cosco, Mike Valentin, Marc Schwartz, Hasnain Akhtar, Aditya Gopinath, Angelena Russo, Sarah Jeter, Joseph Rondinelli, Shantel Green, Aliana Tejeda, Liam Nelson, Jodi-Ann Morgan, David Tassoni

engineeringPark.name: Robotic Musical Chimes (1st year eng. students)
engineeringPark.description: Visitors will be able to listen to and see working student-designed robotic music machines.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Mario Gomes, Zach Angelli, Jacob Lin, Carter Miller, Clayton Terry, Carl Burkhard, Derek Gagnon, Ben Hartman, Omkar Borse, Stuart Hull, Kristin Komendowski, Jacob Gutwirth, Jacob Warner, James Badstuebner, Rhys Thompson, Garrett Waldron, Benjamin Wolfrom, Eric L'Heureux, Will Sheppard, Olivia Vidmar, Amanda Weiss, Walker Hare, Sari Houchaimi, Kayla Llanos, Mitch Allen, Cesar Felipe, Max Sample, Joseph Samuelson, Torie Adler, Sean Clark, Dana Eschler, Jonathan Roux, Neil Bhasme, Caroline Feyling, Aleesha LeRuzic, Sara Zuwiyya

engineeringPark.name: Robots and Artificial Intelligence
engineeringPark.description: This exhibit displays reserach being done in the Multi Agent Bio-Robotics Laboratory in the following fields: Assistive technologies Machine learning Industrial robotics Computer vision
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Shitij Kumar, Tucker Graydon, Ferat Sahin, Matthew Haywood, Alexander Synesael, Celal Savur, Mazin Ali, Mark Pitonyak, Cassandra Derr, Felisa Sze, Bryan Harper, Chloe Bohlman, Steven Giewont, Vishnunandan Venkatesh , Akash Saha

engineeringPark.name: Rotating Dynamometer to Measure Cutting Forces
engineeringPark.description: Machining everyday items like cars, cell phones, or aviation parts need to be made with the highest precision and accuracy possible. There is a constant struggle to find the most accurate way to measure and analyze the cutting force of a machine or tool. In doing so, processes like these can be optimized and drive the cost down for companies, and in turn the consumers. Come see the first step in finding the best optimization.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Joseph Amoia, Muhammad Ibraheem, Elbert Heacock, Zac Rubeor, Brian Coren

engineeringPark.name: Rube Goldberg
engineeringPark.description: A Rube Goldberg chain reaction machine designed to entertain and teach. Young and old will learn a bit about engineering and the Society of Women Engineers' K-12 program, SWE Next, at an engaging and educational exhibit.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Melissa Rideout, Kayla Stephan, Allyssa Cio, Margaret Coulter, Johanna Carroll, Rachel Berry, Danielle Fischer, Melissa Nellist, Meghan Britt, Marissa Burkland, Shelly Mason, Lauren Cussen, Melissa Dubots, Erin Reilly, Emilie MacKinnon, Erin Petrillose, Melissa Valdez, Laura Moon, Alexa Kline, Melissa Calopiz, Julia Provenzano, Hope DiVello, Maggie Brooks, Megan Ritting, Paula Zaretzky, Kyla Driver, Mary McCombs, Nicole Freitag

engineeringPark.name: Sandia Instrumented 3D Printer
engineeringPark.description: One of the most important areas of growth for 3D printing is temperature control. This printer is a commercial printer that has been fitted with an observation network created by our team, which allows the user to record values critical to the build process such as bed temperature and atmospheric temperature while also using a thermal camera to observe the print. Take home a small 3D print from the event as a token of our appreciation!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Michael Muldoon, Justin Rueb, Jon Eames, Ryan Thorna, Jacob Lowe, Ed Hanzlik

engineeringPark.name: ShingleBot: The Future of Robotic Construction
engineeringPark.description: ShingleBot is a robotic shingle removing system controlled via Bluetooth Remote Controller. We have adapted cameras, sensors and actuators to assist the user in tearing off shingles in the fastest, most effective and safest way to date. Come check out the next generation of construction roofing with our battle bot style robot and watch the shingles fly!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: William Lawrie, Brendan Flaherty, Thomas Schwartz, Alicia Kirk, MaryCatherine Murphy, Mark Underhill, David Durfee, Daniel Kaputa

engineeringPark.name: Sigma Sigma Sigma Presents Sign Idol
engineeringPark.description: We are advertising our event Sign Idol. For those of you who do not know what it is, it is similar to American Idol but with ASL. We will be having three judges and those who are performing have a chance to win prizes. It is loads of fun and a great event for the Deaf and Hearing community to come together. (Please note that no ticket sales will occur during Imagine RIT.)
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Cassandra Sinnott

engineeringPark.name: Solar Thermal Water Heater
engineeringPark.description: Solar thermal water heating is a great way to see how the sun's power can be harnessed.
