Come check out how you can capture the sun's energy and use it to heat water without burning coal or natural gas. The advantages of flat plate solar thermal technology is that it is a clean and renewable source of energy. The only thing that needs power is a pump. Come see how we put the sun to work for us!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Sarah Kirk, Alex Slabyk, Deven Greenawalt, MiKe Pastore, Evan Baileys

engineeringPark.name: Solar Transpired Crop Dryer
engineeringPark.description: Come see us sun dry bananas! Our crop dryer passively warms the air using solar radiation to dry bananas for the intention of preventing crop spoilage after large harvests in Haiti.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Kaleigh Sweeney, Louis Kline, Matt Hossack, Kelsey Clements

engineeringPark.name: SportsNet Storage Facility Improvements
engineeringPark.description: SportsNet provided those with disabilities the opportunity to enjoy adaptive sports and recreational activities including cycling, skiing and golfing. Many of these require specialized equipment requiring storage space, provided by SportsNet, while not in use. Initially their storage facility was not efficiently organized and contained safety hazards. The goal of this project was to improve the space utilization within the unit to make storing and locating equipment more efficient and safer.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Sarah Harley, Samantha Cali Smith , Brady Hawkes, Peter Larson, Ed Hanzlik, Michael Cocquyt

engineeringPark.name: St. Joseph's House of Hospitality Improvements
engineeringPark.description: St. Joseph's House of Hospitality is a homeless shelter in downtown Rochester. Our senior design team worked with St. Joseph's staff to make improvements in their shelter operations.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Sharon Im, Ezra Weinstein, Ken Postel, Allyson Komrowski, Connor Pierce

engineeringPark.name: Sunspot Radio Telescope
engineeringPark.description: Sunspots are massive dark spots on the Sun's surface that emit large quantities of radiation, for reasons not fully understood. Working with another sunspot astronomy team in Zurich, SZ, the Astronomy Section at the Rochester Academy of Sciences recently realized there are no solar radio telescopes in the Northeastern US. Our project is intended to clear up that blind spot, and provide ASRAS and Zurich astronomers and student researchers with the ability to study these phenomena.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Brendan Parke, jeff kaiser, Adam Hargrave, Nanthiel Peck, Zachary Smith, Jeffrey Sylor, Martin Pepe

engineeringPark.name: Tesla Turbine
engineeringPark.description: A bladeless turbine that was first patented in 1913 by Nikola Tesla. This iteration is constructed using hard drive platters encased in a chassis that was designed with AutoCad software. The turbine is capable of reaching up to 15,000 rpm.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Scott Williamson, Daniel Yochim, Samuel Shelmidine , Carl Burkhard, Michael Smith, Sarah Ehrhardt, Chris Witmer

engineeringPark.name: The Amazing Microchip
engineeringPark.description: Come and learn how microchips are fabricated in the RIT Semiconductor & Microsystems Fabrication Laboratory. . The dimensions are extremely small, with feature sizes in the nanometer range - over a hundred of them can fit across the width of a human hair! You will see how raw material is transformed into crystalline silicon wafers, and get an overview of the manufacturing process.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Karl Hirschman, Tarun Mudgal, Ryan Hirschman, Eli Powell

engineeringPark.name: The Endless Possibilities of Secondhand Clothing
engineeringPark.description: Textile waste is one of the largest growing problems in the modern world. Many clothing companies are now trying to create sustainable methods of manufacturing and recycling both synthetic and natural fibers. Our project aims to explore these methods and create practical business models for our local Goodwills. Come check out our exhibit and take a sneak peek at the future of sustainable textiles!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Valeria Villa, Erin Podhaisky, Corey King, Pauline Dziama, Catheryn McCarthy

engineeringPark.name: The Gear Chair
engineeringPark.description: The Gear Chair is a wheelchair that utilizes gear hub technology, which allows for a better mechanical advantage. This allows one to propel oneself quicker, move more easily up a hill, or traverse grassy terrain.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Collin Inglut, Alexa Hurlbert, Curran Tobin, Justin McKee, Ryan Hoyt

engineeringPark.name: The Next Revolution: Integrated Photonics
engineeringPark.description: Integrated Photonics will one day revolutionize technology by providing: cheap health diagnostic systems, and three dimensional LIDAR that will be used in self driving cars and household robots. See these photonic chips and demonstrations of the concepts that will power these chips, including, optical internet connections, infrared camera technology, wave phenomena and more!
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Stefan Preble, Zihoa Wang, Abdelsalam Aboketaf, Peichuan Yin, Michael Fanto

engineeringPark.name: Toyota Production Systems Lab
engineeringPark.description: The lab showcases production systems which includes assembly lines and warehousing systems, and which can be extended into other areas such as health care. There will be some form of interactive activity (which we are still designing!)
engineeringPark.exhibitors: John Kaemmerlen, Sidharaj Jadeja, Vaibhav Rungta, Kavish Kathawala, Rahul Kikani, Allyssa Cio, Arden Bonzo, Taylor Smith, Joseph Kleinberger, Rachel Berry, Liz Millar, Siddharth Garg, Gavin Lim, Elmas Koc, Fahd Almassri, Saurabh Paralikar, Ricardo Yupanqui Rivera, Dan Fox, Brady Sweeny

engineeringPark.name: TRAK TECHNOLOGY FOR LOW/MEDIUM VOLUME PRODUCTION
engineeringPark.description: See TRAK CNC equipment in operation and how they are used in industry for product development. Southwestern Industries Demonstration Area. Gleason Room 9-2430 Mechanical Engineering machine shop
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Jan Maneti, Craig Arnold, Mick Wilkinson, Thomas Balmer, Ed Szozda

engineeringPark.name: Vacuum Former at The Construct
engineeringPark.description: Live demonstration of vacuum forming using a student developed vacuum former. Located in The Construct (INS-4190), the project was designed and built by MSD Team 17676.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Nicholas VanderWeide, Nicholas Reed, Steven Henning, Luca Verdi, Alicia Sutphin

engineeringPark.name: Xerox UV-Curing Ink Jetting Printer
engineeringPark.description: A senior design project for creating an ink-jetting printer which utilizes ink which cures via ultraviolet light. This ink can be jetted onto a flat surface such as glass, and cured nearly instantly with a ultraviolet light. This printer has ability to move in the vertical direction, allowing for multiple layers of the ink to be jetted and cured on top of each other. Visitors may view the system and ask questions related to its operation and applications.
engineeringPark.exhibitors: Andrew Fisher, Bocephus Leduc, Mark Swamy, Jose Salas, Charles Dixon, Derek Witt

globalVillage.name: Allegeny River Dancers
globalVillage.description: Visitors will have the opportunity to celebrate Native American culture with a viewing of traditional dancing, done by the Allegany River Dancers. The Allegany River Dancers have traveled and performed extensively throughout the North America and Europe. The Allegany River Dancers are members of the Haudenosaunee Confederacy, also known as the Six Nations. The confederacy includes the Seneca, Cayuga, Onondaga, Mohawk, and the Tuscarora.
globalVillage.exhibitors: Nicole Scott, Jane Doctor, Brendan John, Mikaela David

globalVillage.name: Bending Boundaries Fashion Show
globalVillage.description: The Bending Boundaries Fashion presented by Louis Jenson, show will showcase the LBGTQIA+ community, through an artistic scope. The clothing pieces will shatter gender constructs, allowing designers to represent their art in the most true form possible. This will not only be an educational experience for you guests, but you are also encouraged to dress beyond your comfort zone, showing how you can be part of the revolution within our fashion industry today.

globalVillage.name: Brick Beats Dance Club: A Hip-hop Experience
globalVillage.description: This will be a dance performance including much of the choreography our club has created throughout this school year. It will feature hip-hop and pop tunes and a variety of dance moves. Brick Beats Dance Club is a student club on campus and we are very excited to share our passion for dancing with you. Come check us out!
globalVillage.exhibitors: Nora Pfund, Andrea Hubbard, Shantel Green

globalVillage.name: Club Cafe Gourmet Cold Brew
globalVillage.description: We are giving away free gourmet cold brew and teaching people about coffee!
globalVillage.exhibitors: James Sinka, Alberto Scicali, Sanketh Baht, Lucas Mark, David Whitman-Kinghorn, Michael Mancini

globalVillage.name: Learn a New Language!
globalVillage.description: Start learning a new language today by completing a mini-lesson and earning a certificate. Gain appreciation of world languages and cultures while acquiring communication skills that will increase your ability to connect with a wider, more diverse group of people. Participants will be eligible to enter a free drawing for a limited number of prizes featuring American Sign Language, Arabic, Chinese, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, Russian, and Spanish.
globalVillage.exhibitors: Sara Armengot, Daniela Morschbacher, Yukiko Maru Leary, Elisabetta Sanino D'Amanda, Godys Armengot Mejia, Ida Wilder, Guoming Tian, Masako Murakami, Ulrike Stroszeck, Diane Forbes, Estefania Blanco, Morgan Merrick, Afrah Alfatli, Julia Provenzano, Tanvi Pradhan, Yusuf Ozen, Maiwand Takoor

globalVillage.name: RIT K-12 University Center
globalVillage.description: Did you know that RIT has programs throughout the year for youth? Learn about opportunities for K-12 youth and educators at RIT - including the RIT Kids on Campus summer camp, RIT Gear Up for RCSD 9th graders, and information on arranging visits to campus for youth.

globalVillage.name: Shop One² - Art & Craft Gallery Open House
globalVillage.description: Shop One² is a fine art, craft, and design retail shop that represents RIT artists - alumni, faculty and students. Shop One² is located in Global Village and the destination to find an array of blown glass, wood craft and furniture, jewelry, ceramics, paintings, prints, photography, literary publications, unique gifts and mementos. Shop + Discover + Connect

globalVillage.name: Velocity Urban Dance Crew Workshop
globalVillage.description: Come one, come all to RIT's very own urban dance crew, Velocity, workshop! Get your body moving with fun, creative moves made by our own dance members! This workshop will be held in the Global Village dance studio. No experience needed and all ages are welcome! Be sure to bring water and a friend!
globalVillage.exhibitors: Muhammad-E'jaaz Lawal, Asia Woodside, Emily Rosenthal, Fateemah Saleem, Karen Blanco, Kayla Lindsay, Lipee Vora, Roxanne Daniels, Shaneil Webley-Roberts, Tommy Nguyen, Julia Nguyen

globalVillage.name: WADAIKO: Japanese Taiko Drumming
globalVillage.exhibitors: Victoria Lauren Sardelli, Anne Tan, Patrick Ly, Randall Conrad, Mizuka Yasuda, Asher Bozman, Hector Escobedo, Amy Pham

greenPlace.name: Closing the Circuit for Sustainability
greenPlace.description: RIT's Golisano Institute for Sustainability is all about helping you make good energy choices! Pick up your 'Closing the Circuit for Sustainability' passport at our Welcome Table and travel throughout Sustainability Hall to collect stamps and learn how RIT is helping to make our world more sustainable. Visitors who complete the passport are eligible to win a prize! Hear first-hand from students, take part in interactive games, and learn how you can improve your energy footprint!
greenPlace.exhibitors: Jennifer Russell, Elizabeth Wronko, Donna Podeszek, Alexandra Leader, Wendy Harmon, Ian Gauger, Jessica Hua, Shahana Althaf, Haleh Moghaddasi, Blair Benson, Claire Wu, Moon Hu, Bixiao Shen

greenPlace.name: Digital Capture to Manufacture/Commemorative Coins
greenPlace.description: Ever wanted to see your face on a coin? Stop by Sustainability Hall's fourth floor, where we will use Digital Manufacturing techniques to produce an Imagine RIT 10th anniversary souvenir coin with your profile machined on it. Engineers will take a picture of your face and digitally convert your image to manufacturing instructions for your personalized souvenir. Orders will be taken on a first come, first served basis, and participants will be given a return time to pick up their coins.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Sean McConky, Allen Luccitti, Brandon Baker, Mark Walluk, Domenic Maiola, Tim Murtaugh, Chris Valant, Gerald Hurley, Martin Schooping

greenPlace.name: Henrietta - A Virtual Reality Experience
greenPlace.description: Experience what could be the future of Henrietta - virtually. RIT architecture students have proposed a new town center concept to the Town of Henrietta, and you can explore it first-hand. Participants will don an Oculus Rift virtual reality headset, and will be able to walk around the town center to see the planned buildings in detail - almost as if they are really there.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Nana Andoh, Lelise Bekele, Blair Benson, Zhuming Liu, Fangyuan Shi, Douglas Templeton, Xingyan Wang, Jinyan Xu, Madi Zhunussov

greenPlace.name: Innovations in Sustainability
greenPlace.description: Innovations in Sustainability: Learn what it means to be sustainable according to the 'Triple Bottom Line of Sustainability' - to be able to identify products & services that can meet your sustainability needs. See examples of innovative sustainable technologies such as printable solar cells that take advantage of indoor lighting to provide electricity as well as a 3D-printed model of an offshore wind energy harvesting system that were developed as part of the applied entrepreneurship course at RIT.

greenPlace.name: Net-Zero Energy Architecture
greenPlace.description: The graphics and pre-design research will demonstrate the architectural design process and the creativity and technology required to achieve a truly sustainable building. These will be a very graphically rich display.

greenPlace.name: Rare Earth Play Pit
greenPlace.ageRange: Best suited for those under 6th grade
greenPlace.description: Your kids won't want to miss playing in the rare earth ball pit. Young children will be tasked with finding different colored balls in the Rare Earth Ball Pit that match the color of an element found in a rare earth mine. Older children will be challenged with searching through buckets of beads for the right 'element' and will learn how we mine for these materials.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Gabrielle Gaustad, Alexandra Leader, Leslie Brooks, Jon Schroeder, Aleena Humayun, Kaytlyn Johnson

greenPlace.name: RIT Campus Model
greenPlace.description: This campus model is made by Master of Architecture students. This model is going to show campus buildings with detail and topography. The model allows visitors to understand the characteristics of campus buildings and see the whole campus at one time. The model also presents the outstanding hand modeling skill from architecture students.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Shih Jung Wu, Moon Hu, Bixiao Shen, Claire Wu, Jessica Hua, Fangyuan Shi, Xiaojing Lin

greenPlace.name: Shoot for Sustainability
greenPlace.description: Test your sustainability knowledge and your aim! We will ask questions on sustainability topics such as recycling, waste reduction, and energy usage. For each answer you guess correctly, you will have a chance to shoot a recyclable item into a basket. Questions are available for all age levels, so bring the kids, and come learn about sustainability the fun way.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Mark Lamendola, Kim Heck, Kim Bawden, Hannah Tilson, Kate McArdle, Thomas Ruley, Missy Hall, Jay Wheaton, Martin Schooping, Patsy Hayes

greenPlace.name: Smartie: The Intelligent Waste Bin
greenPlace.description: Smartie is the future of waste disposal. It is a waste bin that deciphers what is trash and what is recyclable. It will automatically sort whatever it is presented with. In addition it will tell the user why an item is or is not recyclable.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Chibueze Onwunaka, Ketki Trimukhe, Guan-Huei Wu, Shih-Husan Huang

greenPlace.name: Solar Shock
greenPlace.ageRange: All ages, kids of ages 5-15 will ejoy this activity
greenPlace.description: This educational exhibit will show the potential and limitations of solar energy by testing how much electricity is needed to power a sound system with a solar panel, as well as the effects of shade on the amount of electricity that is produced. Also, as a fun activity for the kids to visually understand the electricity power, we will demonstrate how much electricity is required to play a music system through piezo electricity and then compare it to solar powered music system.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Heather Cottone, Naga Goteti, Vineet Nair, Eric Williams

greenPlace.name: Sustainability Mini Golf & Packaging Tours
greenPlace.description: A fun, educational mini golf course that teaches about issues in our environment and how we are working to fix them. Learn about packaging on a tour of the Dynamics and Materials Lab.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Samantha Hung-Krause, Jonathan Tuber, Theresa Klingshirn, Mitchel Dickerson, Allison Clements, Sydney Ryan, Daniel Johnson, Deanna Jacob, Carlos Diaz-Acosta, Thomas Kausch, Duane Beck, Georgios Koutsimanis, Erin Aaron, Corbin Gilchrist, Dimitrios Karydias, Nik Miclette, Tom Oommen, Rahul Shah, Mukul Anand Singh, Sneha Sundareshwaran, Chayanit Wongpradit, Taeho Woo, Suha Sheikh, Julee Martin, Annamaie Visalli, Joe Mueller, Finn Robb, Bangyi (Troy) Sun, Emily Minnich, Jonathan Wright, Anna Lorette, Yunjing Jiao, Conrad Kuin, Amanda Olsen, Val Luttman, Allison Dombrosky, Rebecca Simonson, Stanley Goldstein, Natalie Kostraba, Robert Rachetta, Ben Binyamin, Reilly Chark, Mason Lezette, Abigail Cocca, Melanie Cope, Stephen Reed, Alexis Rich, Matilda Wilson

greenPlace.name: Waste-to-Energy Restaurant
greenPlace.description: Join us in engaging with a unique restaurant concept - one in which wasted food isn't thrown away, but is re-purposed into something useful. Learn about the processes that can be used to turn food waste into products like bio-fuel, fertilizer, electricity and more as the 'chefs' make sure no food is truly wasted.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Tom Trabold, Shwe Sin Win, Diana Rodriguez Alberto, Steve Barber, Wendy Harmon, Yang Yue

greenPlace.name: Which is Better?
greenPlace.description: Have you ever wondered if paper or plastic bags are better for the environment? If it is greener to buy a gas or electric vehicle? If energy-efficient lights are worth it? In this exhibit, sustainability students will demonstrate how everyday products compare when it comes to the environment. Using results from 'Life Cycle Assessment', students will show how resource use, manufacturing, packaging, product use, and waste management all add up when considering environmental impacts of products.
greenPlace.exhibitors: Callie Babbitt, Andrew Bailey, Liz Knight, Jackson Hochheimer, Jon Schroeder, Alexandra Leader, Sherwyn Millette, Jaime Sanchez Ferragut, Marta de Guzman, Quinn Whitaker

innovationCenter.name: 1Haler: Revolutionizing Asthma Care
innovationCenter.description: 1Haler is an engineering senior design project focusing in asthma care for rescue situations. Visitors will learn about the prevalence of asthma, how it can be treated, and our innovative design. This exhibit will allow visitors a hands on experience with demos of the 1Haler and other inhalers currently used by asthma patients. The 1Haler is cheaper, easier to use, and more convenient to use than its competitors on the market; this exhibit showcases its novelty.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Taylor Agnello, Chantel Charlebois, Melissa Mendoza, Stephen Choi, Laura Alderfer

innovationCenter.name: A Small Robot Story
innovationCenter.description: A Small Robot Story is a short adventure-platform where you play as Rae, a small robot who activates and has no programming, so you need to set out and find out what's up! With a heavy emphasis on story, A Small Robot Story will take you through forests, factories, caves, laboratories, and more as you track down the source of your sudden activation.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Rob Mostyn

innovationCenter.name: AWARE: Driver Fatigue Solutions
innovationCenter.description: Our student entrepreneur team brings you AWARE: Driver Fatigue Solutions. We are displaying a device that can monitor signs of fatigue and alert users when they are becoming dangerously drowsy. Come try it out for yourself! Meet our team, hear our story, and witness how our idea has developed. We recently raised over $2,000 through successful crowd-funding to further develop our device, so come and see what the buzz is about!
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Ethan Kersat, Emmanuel Dodoo, Zach Moxley

innovationCenter.name: B.U.S. - Be Heard, Unite Voices, Stand Together
innovationCenter.description: B.U.S. is an app designed to connect students who have been bullied as well as concerned parents/teachers. The best way to overcome an instance of bullying is by understanding and knowing that you are not the only person that this has happened to. People can post their stories and read the stories of others so that they can find someone who is, or has, gone through the same thing. 'Be heard, Unite voices, Stand together!'
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Sophia Dower

innovationCenter.name: DADCo: Consumer Focused Electromyography
innovationCenter.description: DADCo wants to bring Electromyography (a biodiagnostic technique) into the consumer marketplace. We will be creating smartwatches and smart wrist-bands that interface with different electrical devices, including but not limited to smartphones, computers, and robotic prosthetics. At Imagine we are showing off a Bionic Hand concept that we have built for an amputee on campus.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Joseph DiPassio, Colin Fausnaught, John Grosh, and Dan Berg

innovationCenter.name: Farewell to Dawn (Personal Viewing Experience)
innovationCenter.description: Farewell to Dawn is a mixed reality dance performance that explores two dancers' voyage from a physical motion capture space to a virtual stage, as the day passes before them. The piece will be presented through the Oculus Rift, a Virtual Reality headset and will allow users the choice to view the performance from the audience of the virtual auditorium or from a seat on the virtual stage.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Joe Geigel, Jacqueline Devine, Eric Knapik, Antara Anilesh Kumar Mishra

innovationCenter.name: Gibraltar: A Lunch-time Strategy Game
innovationCenter.description: In Gibraltar, two players move their pieces around the board in attempt to control territory. The more territory you control, the more moves you can make per turn. This unique take on strategy games and board games allows players more freedom in crafting their own strategies and experiences.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, John Miller

innovationCenter.name: HiBeams - Intelligent Lighting for Longboards
innovationCenter.description: HiBeams is a technology company, started by RIT students Leondro McHenry and James Kemper, developing intelligent motion-based lighting systems for various applications. We will be exhibiting our new prototype, the first intelligent safety lighting system designed specifically for longboards and skateboards. We will be presenting visitors with the technology we've developed through interactive demonstrations.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Leondro McHenry, James Kemper

innovationCenter.name: Kore-X Chiropractic Pressure Mapping Mat
innovationCenter.description: The Kore-X Strength and Stability System is a flexible, portable, wireless smart mat designed for patients with chronic back pain. The mat will help teach patients how to do simple back exercises properly to strengthen and isolate the core back muscles and also provides the capability to track their progress. The product will have an interface that can be downloaded as an app on a mobile device, tablet or laptop.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Evan Vershay

innovationCenter.name: LiftForce: Next Gen. Fitness Technology
innovationCenter.description: LiftForce is a fitness technology company that uses computer vision software to analyze a person's lifting form and provide feedback in real-time. This software is installed in gyms and available for member use. Our mobile app can store and track lifting data, as well as receive biomechanics feedback in the app for improving mobility and thus form.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Evan Oslakovich, Ian Young, Anthony Vullo, Stephen Moskal , Dakota Baber, Nicholas Mattis

innovationCenter.name: Lily Pad - Sensory Play
innovationCenter.description: Lily Pad is an interactive system of smart mats that emit lights, sounds and vibration patterns to guide children with special needs in daily activities. Our exhibit at Imagine RIT will be interactive and will be demonstrating the functionality of the product. Visitors will be able to interact with the pads and and immerse in a sensorial experience with lights and animated projections. Come visit the Lily Pad exhibit and be part of this adventure with us!
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Mariana Leitao Pinheiro

innovationCenter.name: Motorized Pediatric Stander
innovationCenter.description: Pediatric standers are medical devices that allow children who are unable to stand the opportunity to do so. A limitation of many standers is that they are stationary. We are continuing the work of previous RIT teams to develop a universal motorization kit to modify existing pediatric standers. The kit enables children to explore their environment autonomously for the first time. Our new design can be attached to any existing pediatric stander and includes numerous user-centered improvements.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Elizabeth Stegner, Thomas Guerin, Andrew Kowalczyk, Spar Patton, Khalifa Albishr, Sean Garbarino, Ahmed Alzaabi

innovationCenter.name: Otto - Therapy Play
innovationCenter.description: Otto is an interactive device designed for children with special needs. The toy emits lights, sounds and vibration patterns in response to movements such as taping and shaking. In our exhibit at Imagine RIT we will be demonstrating the product and inviting the visitors to play and interact with different versions of Otto.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Mariana Leitao Pinheiro

innovationCenter.name: OWA Haircare - The First Dehydrated Shampoo
innovationCenter.description: OWA Haircare is an innovative hair care company that is revolutionizing the industry by offering plant-based, environmentally friendly products to humans who support a sustainable life on planet Earth. Get a sneak peak of OWA's first product - a waterless shampoo!
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Kailey Bradt

innovationCenter.name: PuckPasser
innovationCenter.description: P.A.P.P.I, The Portable Automated puck passing implement,is an automated puck passing and shooting device, designed to quickly, safely and easily provide the user with game equivalent passes and shots that are both accurate and an appropriate velocity for the user's level. P.A.P.P.I can be used to assist the user with both team and individual drills and it also has adjustable speed, rotation, tilting and shot intervals. The unit is easy to transport on and off the ice and it features a goalie mode that focuses on the weak spots of a goalie to assist coaches and players with goalie training.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Diane Cantisano, Doug Yencer, Ryan Parsons, Chad Uckermark , Spencer Argenna, Matthew Webster

innovationCenter.name: RIT's Venture Creations Business Incubator
innovationCenter.description: Come join RIT's Venture Creations Business Incubator as we showcase some of our start-up company clients including: ThermApparel; Positive Science; Empire Medicinals; Hand Scan; and Dimension Technologies. You'll have a chance to learn about these companies and their exciting projects, meet the entrepreneurs behind the companies, and learn about how RIT is supporting the development and growth of start-ups throughout our region.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Cindy Papaleo, Rich Notargiacomo, Jeff Arywitz, Tom Curtin, Kurtis Kracke, Chris Carter, George Zheng, Brad Sparks, Jason Babcock, Luke Luft

innovationCenter.name: Rock Stars
innovationCenter.description: The Rock Stars rock climbing project was given to us in the IDEA Lab last semester. We were to develop a product that would help children with autism or attention disorders to rock climb. Proposed solutions were to use lights, sounds, and texture on, inside, or around a rock climbing peg.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Evan Misiorski

innovationCenter.name: Scrubbing Bubbles
innovationCenter.description: We have designed a Roomba vacuum that will be converted it into a model of the 'Scrubbing Bubbles' character. It will still acts as a vacuum and blows bubbles as it moves around Student Innovation Hall.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Dan Schneiderman, Nathaniel Larrimore

innovationCenter.name: Transfer Lift for Adaptive Ski Programs
innovationCenter.description: Our team is working to improve accessibility for skiers with impaired leg movement. We've partnered with Swain Mountain's Shared Ski Adventures program to build a lift that will help them transfer skiers from a wheelchair to a sit ski and back, which reduces strain on volunteers who currently have to lift skiers manually.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Ana Sorensen, David Villareal, Christopher Shyne, Tom Janosky, Samkit Lunawat

innovationCenter.name: Virtual Reality Arm
innovationCenter.description: Imagine an anatomy or drawing instructor speaking to students and being able to touch the skin on a virtual model to make it disappear and expose the anatomy underneath. If we can develop a system to draw from a virtual figure we can expand student understanding of the human body as well as expand the definition of the drawing studio and change how we teach life draw.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Craig Foster, Allison Buck, Danielle Sternberg, Shannon Gregory, Katelyn Fiebke, Alexander Cook, Jesse O'Brien, Tim Yuan, Joey Tong, Jenn Hinton

innovationCenter.name: Wheelness: Wheelchair Wellness
innovationCenter.description: A wearable device for wheelchair users that tracks activity and aids therapy. Concept and Prototype.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Deepti Chintalapudi, Gagan Ahuja, Grace Yukawa

ntidArea.name: ASL Storyteller: A Visual Language App for Kids!
ntidArea.description: ASL Storyteller is an early childhood educational app that reinforces their first language system through visual language. It utilizes a unique way of telling interactive stories in American Sign Language that keeps Deaf culture at its adapted forefront. i.e. Characters in our stories are showing Deaf etiquette, Deaf way of communicating and providing interactive components to encourage both parents and their children to 'co-learn'.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Joo Yeon Chang, Logan Lugo, Julie Love

ntidArea.name: ASLNet: Video Captioning American Sign Language
ntidArea.description: Imagine a scenario where you don't know american sign language and wanted to talk to someone who's Deaf/Hard of Hearing (DHH). While you could type your messages on a phone, it is not sufficient to facilitate a natural mode of communication between the speakers - the modes being 'speech' for the hearing and 'sign language' for the DHH. In this exhibit, you'll see a machine that can automatically interpret American Sign Language and display it on a screen.

ntidArea.name: Cherry: Sound Localization for People Who are DHH
ntidArea.description: Cherry is an assistive wearable device aimed to aid people who are DHH (deaf or hard of hearing). Only 20% of the total numbers of people with hearing disabilities use some kind of aid in their day to day lives. Some of the factors that keep people from using these hearing aids include stigma towards people wearing these devices, value in terms of functionality provided by the aid, maintenance, efficiency etc. Cherry aims to get rid of the stigma associated with devices that aid people who are DHH.

ntidArea.name: Deaf Pioneers Adventure App Development
ntidArea.description: This exhibit highlights some innovative features in 3-D adventure storytelling and gaming. This app takes users on a first- and third-person narration through animation, gaming and language texts (ASL and English) about Lauren Redden Searing who was a deaf poet and journalist in the United States during the late nineteenth century.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Christopher Kurz, Gary Behm, Heather Smith-Schmitz, Jenny Sipiora, Ashley Wood, Aaron Nusbaum, Alexis Lazaro

ntidArea.name: Deaf Restaurant
ntidArea.description: We want to ask you for food/sauce flavor ideas for our startup restaurant business this year (or next year). Please visit us and fill out our ten-question survey to help us collect information.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Yeh Kim, Andrew Cho, Faith Benton

ntidArea.name: Goodbye, Goodbuy!
ntidArea.description: What happens to your furniture when you move out in the spring? Does it get tossed in the dumpster and sent to a landfill? Goodbye, Goodbuy! has made it their mission to reduce RIT's landfill contributions, and instead extend the life cycle of your dorm room accessories. See the cycle that Goodbye, Goodbuy! has implemented for unwanted furniture, clothing, and odds 'n ends!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Erica Hickey, Benjamin Hamilton, Leandra Baldwin

ntidArea.name: On-Call Interpreter Queuing App
ntidArea.description: Have you ever needed Interpreter services last minute? Have you had difficulty scheduling short term interpreter support? If any of you have had experience with this you will know it can be a difficult and stressful experience! But, this App is designed to schedule short term appointments between RIT students and faculty with Interpreters in a direct and efficient manner. Come by to test the app and provide us with your suggestions and insights!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Jocelyn Lazo, David Stolze, Andrew Kline, Joan Bempong

ntidArea.name: Rochester Bridges to the Doctorate Program
ntidArea.description: Are you Deaf or Hard of Hearing and interested in becoming a scientist or know someone who is? The Rochester Bridges to the Doctorate Program is the first of its kind that provides master's level mentoring and guidance toward admission to a doctoral degree program in biomedical and behavioral science disciplines. Come see us to learn more about the opportunities we have available!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Nikki Cherry, Peter Hauser, Scott Smith, Jess Cuculick, Jeff Shaul, Andrea Amati, Sara Blick, PJ Simpson-Haidaris

ntidArea.name: Scrap Value Extraction for Markin Tubing
ntidArea.description: Markin Tubing LP has recently approved the Scrap Value Extraction Project in support of its vision to utilize the scrap metal generated from its production processes. The profits of the company could be increased substantially if the value of the scrap metal can be increased or harnessed more efficiently. The study is done primarily to look at various innovative ways through how the scarp could be more useful to the company both to sell as a bulk or to include it in its production process.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Julissa Pozo Nuñez, Aleyca De Leon Roman, Asim Wankhade

ntidArea.name: Sign Language to Text
ntidArea.description: ASL to Text attempts to bridge the gap between the deaf and hearing communities by creating a system of automatic interpretation of sign language. Although many different technologies exist for transcribing voice to text, only a few technologies exist for transcribing sign language to text. Unfortunately these solutions are fairly expensive. ASL to Text is free (as it relies on webcams) and open source.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Nicholas Wilkins, Michael Johnson, Nikolas Kelly, Emily Thomas, Kyle Cutler, Caroline Davis, Edith Dong

ntidArea.name: SK8MAG: Magnetic Connection for Bags
ntidArea.description: A Magnetic coupling on the backpack to attach/detach any carry on items from the backpack with ease. This is especially useful when you're quickly on the go or need an extra hand to carry more items. Ideal for hikers, athletes, and transporters.

ntidArea.name: Tiger Media
ntidArea.description: This is an opportunity for our tiger media organization at NTID to advertise about us with freebies plus we will have photobooth, too.

ntidArea.name: Translation MAGIC!
ntidArea.description: Join us at the Fireside Lounge in the Student Alumni Union for Translation MAGIC!

ntidArea.name: Wavio
ntidArea.description: Are you tired of missing the sounds of fire alarm, doorbell, baby crying, water faucet running, and countless of sounds in your home? Stop buying those individual devices to capture and identify all the critical sounds. We have an all-in-one solution for you!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Spencer Montan, Greyson Watkins , Nicholas Lamb , Zachary Baltzer

recreationZone.name: 2017 ARM Student Design Contest
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Be a judge and vote for your favorite student invention! Projects demonstrate how ARM technology can be used to enhance some of the tasks that we do from day to day. The vast majority of smartphones and tablets, as well as a large variety of other devices, use ARM processors. Votes will be tallied at the end of the day to select winning teams, and students on those teams will receive prizes.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Roy Melton, George Slack, Louis Beato, Jeff Jaskier, Rachael Stroebel, David Pyenson, Charles Rudkin, Evan Halpern, Joshua Milas, Joseph Gambino, Evan McDonough, Ian Doten, Matthias Galley, Fernando Soto, Anthony Ballister, Andrew Gordon, Dylan Boberg, Jehad Al Dabbous, Gwen Neuhaus, Liam Herlihy, Brent Chase, Dakota Bassett, Joseph Clifford, Grigoriy Gressel, Maria Ace, Abagail Bleakney, Emma Sarles, Kyle Tevis, Forrest Shooster, Eric Roth, Nicole Sauter, Carolyn Krasniak, Jaclyn Amann, Arshia Sasson, Emmanuel Aire, Nicholas Jakse

recreationZone.name: 3D-360 Video with the Facebook Surround 360
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The Facebook Surround 360 is a durable and high quality 3D-360 camera system that produces 3D, truly spherical VR footage. A group of students from multiple disiplines has come together to build this device and test the systems that make 3D-360 capture possible. Come see what a 3D-360 video is like and be a part of the recorded video we will be capturing at Imagine RIT.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Nick Franco, Kirsten Martin, Madison Zic, Joey Competiello, Sam Rushton

recreationZone.name: 3D-Printed Prostheses for Underserved Communities
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Do you want to see how 3D-scanning and 3D-printing technologies are making prosthetics accessible to people who need them all over the world? Come visit our display where you can watch a person be 3D-scanned right before your eyes-- or better yet, be that person! You can also get a hands-on look at a number of 3D-printed prosthetic devices, and watch as one is 3D-printed in front of you!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jade Myers, Brandon Powell, Laura Alderfer, Tyler Roneker, Will Byron, Emma Sarles

recreationZone.name: ABRACADABRA: Robotic Braiding Device
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The Society of Manufacturing Engineers has built the ABRACADABRAID system from scratch. Each mechanism, from the spools, to the braided rope, to the fusing and cutting systems has been meticulously designed and tested to ensure that each keychain handed out is both robust and durable. These paracord keychains will be made right in front of the visitors, and will be handed out within seconds! Keychains will be distributed until SME runs out of paracord. Get your keychain before it's too late!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Scott Bell, Michael Traughber, Nicole Cuello Wajdowicz, Andrew Clark, Kory Schimmelpfennig, Marin Sammons

recreationZone.name: Air Force Explosive Ordinance Disposal
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Get an inside peak at how Explosive Ordinance Disposal experts in the Air Force utilize cutting edge technology to keep military units on the battlefield safe from numerous threats.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Zachariah Gonyea

recreationZone.name: Alumni Oasis & Benefits Fair
recreationZone.building: Gene Polisseni Center
recreationZone.description: RIT alumni and their families are invited to visit the Alumni Oasis in the lobby of the Gene Polisseni Center for relaxation and complimentary refreshments during the festival. Guests will have the opportunity to pick up a complimentary alumni gift, test their skills at the Chaos Obstacle Course (ages 6 & up), take candid photos, discover what classes are available through "Kids on Campus", learn about Alumni House, get a RIT Alumni ID card, and more! A special thank you to Sharp Notions and Liberty Mutual for their sponsorship.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Candi Boston

recreationZone.name: Chainmail Workshop
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Make your own chainmail project using the centuries-old technique of linking small rings of metal. No experience needed. Tools and materials supplied.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Teresa Kugler, Alexander Howard, Nicole Hill, Alice Fischer, Kian Hein, Thomas Bouffard, Sara Nuffer, Emily Jackson, Anna Raleigh, Mariya Belchikova, Tony Bacchetta, Jason Clar, Tig , Angie Krieg, Ryan Wren

recreationZone.name: Coca-Cola: Powerade Climbing Wall & Product Sampling
recreationZone.building: Outside
recreationZone.description: Join us outside the Gordon Field House for some product sampling and wall climbing!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Heather Cottone

recreationZone.name: Concrete Canoe
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Each year students compete to design, build, and a race a canoe made out of concrete. Canoes float when fully submerged in water but rely on hull design to maintain stability during races. Canoes can weigh between 90 and 500 pounds. We will have on display one of our concrete canoes and show you how it works. Please be advised that for safety reasons during the festival, visitors are not allowed to enter the water or the concrete canoe.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Tyler Becker, Andrew Walker, Lindsey Siganowich, Mike Salvatori, Tiffany Zheng, Briana Clark, Brady Smith, Chris Kiripolsky, Jim Ritzenthaler, Will LaRose, Greg Delahoy, Robert Schubert, Brad Pozzi, Paul Fowler, Wes Foster, Brennan Verges, Caitlyn Brewster, Devin Vickery, Garrett Maynard, Lois Furioso, AJ Calabrese, Kaho Liang, Syed Zamin, Klint Brown, Gabriel Watson, Daylen Smith, Joanna MacIntyre

recreationZone.name: Connecting Academics with the Community
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: RIT works in co-equal partnership with residents in the city of Rochester to support and propel implementation of community revitalization projects while deepening the learning for RIT students. Learn about RIT community-based participatory research projects including, "Urban Sustainability: Rethinking Vacant Lots." Explore displays, video, and photo montages of the research projects. Anyone can be a creative innovator and help develop vacant land into flourishing community green spaces.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jane Amstey, M. Ann Howard, Tunya Griffin, Alexanna Page, Kara Tenpas, Steven Akin, Jovon Mccullough, Sarah Dobie

recreationZone.name: Creative Movement and Juggling
recreationZone.building: Hale-Andrews Student Life Center
recreationZone.description: You're invited to come enjoy creative play and movement with the RIT Juggling Club. Juggling involves constant creativity, the willingness to try new things, and is scientifically proven to grow your brain. Whether you come to watch, take pictures, or stay and play, you're guaranteed to love the good, healthy fun. All ages are welcome!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Sebastian Ferlo, Dan Pisarcik, Luke Familo, Jeff Peden, Nic Bove, Samuel Kilgore, William Carver, Blaz Martinez, Enan Munzar, Greg Moss, Jared Athias

recreationZone.name: Criminal Justice, Law and the Community
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Experience the diverse groups who have worked diligently to improve life in Rochester. Some featured activities include presentations by criminal justice students in cooperation with local criminal justice agencies, and community groups. Some exciting activities include interactive computer programs to test your cognitive problem solving skills, and an interactive exhibit using crime analysis techniques. In addition, the Researchers of RIT would like to collect information pertaining to your attitudes on opioids and the opioid epidemic. Please take our survey that can be remotely accessed by your mobile device. You can also scan the QR code that is pictured here. Please visit us at https://tinyurl.com/CPSI-2017 Or find our survey on twitter! @CPSI_2017
recreationZone.exhibitors: Amy D'Amico, Tayler Ruggero, Chris Sweadner, Chaquan Smith, John Klofas, Kayla Macano, Na Liu, Shayna Gray, Sujeong Seo, Thomas Noel, Janelle Duda-Banwar

recreationZone.name: D&C Digital
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Come join D&C Digital in the Gordon Field House!
recreationZone.exhibitors: D&C Digital

recreationZone.name: Deployable Noise Meter
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Our senior design project is to develop a device that will measure the friendly competition between colleges at RIT's convocation ceremony for graduation. Currently competition is solely based on the Provost & therefore bias based on location of each college. With the large population of deaf/hard of hearing students, the device also has to accommodate and quantify deaf applause. There will be an interactive display where you can see how much excitement you can produce.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jillian Walsh, Nathan Burlee , Vashti Green, Sergio Martins

recreationZone.name: Diving Extravaganza
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Come see some of the best divers in the USA. The Diving Extravaganza has great diving, trick diving, and synchronized diving - all to your favorite upbeat music!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Clifford Devries

recreationZone.name: Electric Vehicle Team Display
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The RIT Electric Vehicle Team is a student run organization dedicated to promoting electric vehicles on a worldwide stage through the demonstration of real world electric drive trains. Come see our vehicles! We will have electric bicycles, an electric go kart, and an all-electric racing motorcycle on display!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jeffrey Botticello, Alex Young, Ryan Thorna, Will McCaffrey, Nicholas Brown, Joseph Rondinelli, Kaleb Kang, Jeff Ryno, Zach Price, Ishan Chhabra, Andrew Eberhard, Garrett Hebbard, Michael Mroz, Blake Cymerys, Murali Prasad, Ryan Murphy, Greg Malanga, Ben Cooper, Larissa Plakson, Justin Beigel, Alan Kuffner, Tyler Roy, Lucas Horigan, Gus Guider, Jacob Felice, Sydney Lizarazo, Dan Shapiro, Jonathan Bontemps, Braeden Morrison, Chris Ferri, DJ Scarpellino, Stephen Pham, Derek Gutheil, Zach Cooper, Karl Smolenski, Ben Stewart, Jacob Goerner, Nathaniel Wilcox, Aaron MacWilliams, Zachariah Martinez, Hannah Kim, John Jenco, Steve Titus, Matthew Hushion, Nathaniel Tong, Soren Suver, Jacob Martinez, Wheeler Law, Reilly Baker, Melissa Rodriguez, Erica Stevens

recreationZone.name: Electromagnetic Dart Launcher
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Come and test your aim using our electromagnetic dart launcher in a fun carnival style game.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Benjamin Hamilton, Ryan Kent, Wystan Wang, Travis Chaikin, Jackson Radler, James Smith, Alexis Rudesil

recreationZone.name: En Garde! Learn to Fence with RIT Fencing Club
recreationZone.building: Hale-Andrews Student Life Center
recreationZone.description: Come try the Olympic sport that brought home four medals for Team USA in Rio! Safe, fun, and perfect for any age, fencing has a long history at RIT, being the very first sport available to women when the university became co-ed. Now it's your turn - come on by to get a lesson from members of our club and take on the challenge yourself.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Molly Hill, Benjamin Maitland, Joanna Ye, Michael Capra, Maxwell Levesque, Eric Mitchell, Ian Taylor, Tucker Kiwitt, Dylan Smith

recreationZone.name: Expect Zone (EZ)
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Our product is a rear view mirror that contains 3 flashing lights (red, yellow, and blue) that deaf or hard of hearing drivers can sense if any of emergency team vehicle is approaching nearby.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Tanner Ketchum, Amelia Hamilton

recreationZone.name: EZ-GAS: Imaging for Car Emissions Characterization
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Ever wondered how to visualize the unseen paths of gas in the environment? What kinds of emissions are coming from your car's tailpipe when you drive? The first year graduate students from the Imaging Science Department have been exploring this topic all year, and have some exciting technologies to demonstrate. Come see how infrared light can be used to see the gas that is all around us!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Catherine Fromm, Runchen Zhao, Tyler Hayes, Prateek R. Srivastava, Manoj Archarya, Mingming Wang, Baabak Mamaghani, Cody Webber, Anjali Jogeshwar, Charlie Tabor, Chris Lapszynski, Josh Frechem, Cara Murphy, Keegan McCoy, Ethan Hughes, Tyler Peery, Zack Mullhollan, Aditya Kunwar, Aayush Chaudhary, Alex Fafard

recreationZone.name: Festival Merchandise by Barnes & Noble @ RIT
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Stop by the Barnes & Noble booth to check out this year's festival merchandise! Cash or credit is accepted.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Heather Cottone, Peter Briggs

recreationZone.name: FIRST Robotics Showcase
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The FIRST Robotics showcase will be a scaled down version of the FIRST Robotics challenge that is hosted at RIT each year. We have built a challenge field and robots for people to drive in a two and a half minute competition where the robots will score points by shooting or pushing ping pong balls into goals at each end of the field. We will also have exhibitors there for you to ask questions about FIRST and more about the different challenges FIRST puts on for all age groups.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Dustyn Crowley, Brett Johnson, Gregory Goh, Ben Whipker, matthew Nygren, Connor Henley, Emily Jackson

recreationZone.name: FriendlyU - Connecting Learners Through Interests
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: FriendlyU is a platform that connects high school students to college students at universities they're considering during their decision-making process. We offer a peer-to-peer connection through common interests, clubs, and academics. Fall 2016 grand prize winner of RIT's Tiger Tank competition. Website: https://FriendlyU.com iOS: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/friendlyu/id963421205?ls=1&mt=8 Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.friendlyu.android
recreationZone.exhibitors: Henry Saniuk, Darrin Loeliger, Emma Strongin, Stuart Olivera, Sneha Vaswani, Harlan Haskins, Sam Heckle, Peter Zujko, Alex Struminger

recreationZone.name: Home Automation
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Smart Homes have been becoming more popular with the introduction of consumer grade smart devices. However, most solutions are a one size fits all and do not cater to those who want a customized solution. Our home automation framework allows users to fit it to their needs with easy to use interfaces and plug-able back ends.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Joshua Milas, Joseph Gambino, Ian Doten, Evan McDonough

recreationZone.name: Hot Wheelz Formula SAE Electric Vehicle Team
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: We are the all-female RIT Hot Wheelz Formula SAE Electric Vehicle Team. We participate in the SAE Formula Hybrid competition to showcase the strong hands-on design, manufacturing, and project management expertise, as well as general problem-solving skills, that women can bring to the table for a complex engineering project. Come see our electric vehicle that just debuted in the 2017 competition!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Melissa Miller, Claudia Alant, Lynn Atene, Caitlin Babul, Jadziah Barchet, Zoe Bottcher, Tiffani Bragg, Kendra Brock, Alexandra Capodicasa, Sarah Clayton, Rebecca Coronel, Olivia Crouse, Allison Fink, Annika Garbers, Jenny Genovese, Alaysia Gilbert, Kaylie Glynn, Cindy Gomez Silva, Holly Gubanc, Shannon Gulvin, Eva Hall, Rachel Heise, Kathryn Hlynsky, Sophie Hopps-Weber, Annie Huang, Amiee Jackson, Samantha Jacobson, Morgan Johnson, Elise King, Jenna Levitt, Jordan Rose Mack, Allison McGowan, Rebecca Michalski, Mychaela Navel, Jenna Needleman, Samantha Poeppelman, Kara Tenpas, Lian Wong, MacKenzie Woodhouse, Celeste Zalapa Gallegos, Kristin Zatwarnicki

recreationZone.name: Image RIT
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Learn about images, cameras, and how snapchat filters work! Experiment, see your work in real time, and take home a new profile picture!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Nathan Dileas, Ryan Hartzell, Anna Karwacki

recreationZone.name: Imaging a Future for the Past
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: A new collaborative organization, Rochester Cultural Heritage Imaging, Visualization, and Education ("RCHIVE") unites imaging expertise at RIT with scholars of the humanities at the University of Rochester with the goal of recovering writings of historical importance that have been lost due to age, neglect, or deliberate damage. This has the potential of making Rochester a world focus for the work of preserving and disseminating priceless cultural heritage.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Roger Easton, Tania Kleynhans, David Lewis, Anna Starynska, Helen Davies, Alexander Zawacki, Lisa Wright, Elizabeth Bogart, Susan Farnand, Gregory Heyworth, Sarah Higley, Tyler Peery, Di Bai, David Messinger

recreationZone.name: Intelligent Mobility Cane with Indoor Navigation
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The project aims at two systems, that is, it alerts the user about side drop-off & other obstacles, and it detects things above head level. The difficulties faced by visually impaired are mobility and navigation. The aim of this project is to communicate with blind and deaf people through position based vibration feedback and to provide guidance with the help of navigation system.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Tanmay Shinde

recreationZone.name: Iris Portraits
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Get a picture of your eye taken by RIT's Photo Science Club. We'll make those pigments shine!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Geoffrey Sasaki, Christye Sisson, Sam Kang, Nanette Salvaggio, Abigail Semler, Nhung Pham, Alex Shipman, Madi Hammond, Leah Meltser, Kelsey Kreider, Jason Dinelli, Daniel Beim

recreationZone.name: Judo Club Demo
recreationZone.building: Hale-Andrews Student Life Center
recreationZone.description: Come watch Judo Club members demonstrate some throws! Great for self-defense, exercise or competitive sport! We will perform standing techniques as well as ground techniques. Come and go as you please! All ages welcome!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Moises Gomez, Adam Kuhn, Steven Cerqueira , Casey Jordan, Stephen Cosco, Jason Menezes, Matthew Landolfa, Nicole Lockwood, James Martinez , Jamal Henderson , Joseph Phillips

recreationZone.name: Learn Quidditch with the RIT Dark Marks
recreationZone.building: Outside
recreationZone.description: Quidditch, based on the Harry Potter series by J K Rowling, is now its own sports community within the US. The United States Quidditch Association facilitates regional and national tournaments in the Fall, Winter, and Spring seasons for officially recognized teams. At our exhibit, visitors have a chance to learn about and play the up-and-coming sport. RIT Quidditch Club will teach you the rules and host mini-scrimmages, which are co-ed and have no age restrictions.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Eliza Harvey, Mitch Brown, Camille Johnson, Alex Daesener, Laurel Perweiler, Michael Capra, Rebecca Froling, Matt Harvey, Ethan Adler, Amanda Michels, Maria Quartararo, Courteney Oare, Brenen Murphey, Zachary Stewart, Sara Wright, Brendan Jacobs, Russell Cobb, Brian Traub

recreationZone.name: Modern Manufacturing with the Manufacturing & Mechanical Engineering Technology Department in Partnership with General Motors
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Manufacturing & Mechanical Engineering Technology (MMET) students will be working alongside the General Motors (GM) Tonawanda Engine Build Team and will teardown/rebuild a Corvette engine while discussing modern automated manufacturing. GM, a silver sponsor of Imagine RIT, has donated the engine to the MMET Department for use in future classes. GM will also display two vehicles in the Field House, including a Corvette.
recreationZone.exhibitors: General Motors

recreationZone.name: Movie Wizardry Through Virtual Cinematography
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Did you ever wonder how they made all those special effects in the movie Avatar? Or any other movie where incredible creatures appear to come to life in amazing fantasy worlds? This exhibit lets you peek behind the curtain to see how it's done. Come see a high-tech system which uses cutting-edge imaging technology to transfer every movement an actor makes to a virtual movie set where they are mimicked by an animated character. Step in front of the camera and make your own movie magic!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Joe Pow, David Long, Adam Reitz, Adam Burke, Allegra Dziedzic, Ari Prokos, Cameron Calandra, Gregory Nero, Haley Wiskoski, Ian Smith, Julian Anderson, Leonard Wilkinson, Olivia Fox, Peter Jarvis, Sophia Edgar, Spencer Staats, Tom Caruso, Vlad Simion

recreationZone.name: Passenger Car Driving Simulator
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.ageRange: Must be 16 years or older and hold a valid learner's permit or liscence.
recreationZone.description: Imagine that you are driving a real automobile while conversing with a friend using a spoken or sign language of your choice. What if a vehicle coming towards you veers into your lane - what would you do? Do you think you'd notice? Do you think you'd be able to steer your vehicle out of harm's way? Our exhibit will allow you to test your driving ability, safely, under the conditions described above. Our simulator is designed to accommodate hearing, hard-of-hearing and deaf drivers.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Martin Gordon, Canyon Aspy, Ethan Lestico, Armando Neto, Kenny Bach, Sven Patterson, Fares El Tin

recreationZone.name: Plastic Bottle Upcycling in Haiti and Nicaragua
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Plastic waste is an untapped resource that can be both removed and reused. In this multidisciplinary intercollegiate project, designers and engineers join forces to develop a product and process to better the world one bottle at a time. Come experience the magic of the design process and see how we are taking bottles and turning them into something useful for the people of Nicaragua and Haiti. You will even have the chance to help with our efforts to change the world one bottle at a time.
recreationZone.exhibitors: David Swerzenski, Mohd Afifi Ishak, Evan Oslakovich, Mike Kist

recreationZone.name: Playing with Computer Science
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Kids can now use inexpensive mini computers to make their own toys, projects, gadgets, and cool costumes. Come see small computers you can use to build games, create computerized Halloween costumes, build a simple robot to water your plants, and even make your own computer vision system. Come learn about physical computing, interactive computing, and how you can play with computer science.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Thomas Kinsman, Preeti Sah, Gauri Khodaskar, Ariel Viggiano, Siddhartha Nutulapati, Yuqing Guo, Daniel Zamora, Cynthia Zachar, Justin Cohen, Hayden Nier, Marissa Haddock, Supriya Godge, Rahul Dashora, Pratham Mehta, Manya Gulati, Mansi Nahar, Lynn Kinsman, Duncan Kinsman, Ami Patel

recreationZone.name: Professional Interactions Using Mobile Apps
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The purpose of this exhibit is to show how current mobile applications might be used to enhance communication interactions especially among deaf and hearing individuals. This exhibit will demonstrate selected Apple and Android communication apps and will summarize student experiences using such apps. Participants will be invited to engage in hands-on exploration of highlighted apps.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Linda Gottermeier, Elizabeth Jackson Machmer, Gabriel Ceni, Michael Liam Wentland, Malakia Gowan, Jonathan Mattmann, Erick Camacho

recreationZone.name: Prosthetics to Special Effects: Life Mask Creation
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Students will work in teams, demonstrating facial casting in the creation of life masks. A new casting will begin on the half hour. The first twelve people to register can leave the festival with a cast of their face. For the under 18 crowd, digits will be cast and everyone (including the adults) can leave with a 'thumb-on-a-stick'. Finished facial prosthetics will be on display to help the audience understand where we go after the facial cast.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Joyce Hertzson, Margaret McFarland, Danielle Sternberg, Helen Snell, Jordana Deutsch, Ouliana Nikolaeva, tara gordon, Allyson Porter

recreationZone.name: Puppy Prosthetic
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: A four-year-old German Shepherd-Lab Mix named Kara had her right hind leg amputated when she was a puppy due to neglect and injury. Animal prosthetics are becoming more and more common and could be a great solution for Kara and her owner. The goals for this project are to design, prototype, test, and 3D print a prosthetic leg for Kara so that she can perform all of the activities that every dog should be able to do with ease and improve her quality of life.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Susan Aikman, James McGee, Ally Meile, Brandon Powell, Jessica Godard, Tom Bitter

recreationZone.name: Robofish Charging Station
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The Robofish Charging Station is a floating platform that automatically docks and charges a robotic fish (the Robofish). When the Robofish is low on power it will seek out the station and perform a docking sequence in order to recharge. The station harvests renewable energy through solar panels. Make your way over to the pool to check out the station in action!
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jack Moore, Garrett Burgwardt, Johan Nasution, Brittany McCord, Lu Aung, Chris Parker

recreationZone.name: Seneca Park Zoo's Biodiversity Exploration Exhibit
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Come experience a new exhibit from the Seneca Park Zoo! Visitors of all ages are welcome to come and experience the interactive stations that can be found in the exhibit space at the zoo. Learn about biodiversity in the Genesee River through gameplay.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Miguel Murphy, Tom Snyder, Natalie Alfke, DK Bohrer, Fernando Soto, Zach Welch

recreationZone.name: Simulation & Behavioral Health: Meet Avatars/SimMan
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Interact with virtual reality avatars, RITa and RITchie, around how substance use, aggression, and violence in the home and relationships negatively affect physical/mental health. Also interact with SimMan; a virtual patient simulator used to train students/medical personnel through realistic patient encounters. Attendees can witness SimMan's breathing, blinking, heartrate/blood pressure, and even talking in response to different medical/behavioral health situations.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Caroline Easton, Richard Dooolittle, Keli DiRisio, Brittany St. Jean, Cassandra Berbary, Joshua Aldred, Jason Chung, Akshay Kumar Arun, Anthony Perez, Karie Carita, Alli O'Malley, Nicole Trabold

recreationZone.name: Soft Inflatable Walking Robot
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Come see the research and development that will help make Baymax (a soft, friendly inflatable robot) a reality.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Amanda Drake, Trevor Brudz, Avery Becker, Naveena Shanmugam, Nicole Casacci, Cameron Crowl

recreationZone.name: SPEX: Space Exploration Multidisciplinary Missions
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: RIT SPEX's main goal is furthering students' knowledge of space technology. Our exhibit focuses on our biggest overall mission, RIT's first ever satellite. Visitors will see an animation of a CubeSat in space. A 3D-model of the CubeSat will also rotate in sync with a physical one and be displayed on a monitor. Other SPEX projects will be highlighted, such as a live stream of our High Altitude Balloon launch and the ability to remotely control one of our telescopes.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Amber Dubill, Mihail Barbosu, Drew Walters, Ihab Mardini, Jesse Florio

recreationZone.name: Starfish Gripper Underwater Soft Robot
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: You like robots? We've got a robot! Come check out an underwater soft robot that mimics a starfish! Soft robotics use soft, deformable materials to mimic muscles and create motion. These soft robots can be used to carefully grasp delicate objects and shapes that conventional robotics are ill-equipped to handle. Come watch our gripper pick up objects in an underwater environment.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jonathan Greeley, Matthew Landolfa, Duy Tran, Derek Cloos, Giordan Meyer

recreationZone.name: STEM Outreach for Advanced Manufacturing
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: This year's Manufacturing Engineering Technology students have designed and developed a portable bottling work cell that will be transported to high schools and colleges for students to get more involved in the manufacturing field.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Marc Lopez Andreu, Josh Walden, jonathan Bresler, Duane Beck

recreationZone.name: Strongman Competition
recreationZone.building: Outside
recreationZone.description: Would you like to see amazing feats of strength?! How about a display of shear will and determination?! Come and see the 10th annual RIT Weightlifting Club's Strongman Competition! Strongman is a sport where competitors from all different backgrounds gather up and try to move really heavy items further and faster than their competitors.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Jason Whyte, Devin Liu, Matthew Andrews, Tim Thurnau

recreationZone.name: Theme Park Engineering 3.0
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The RIT Theme Park Enthusiasts are back this year presenting Theme Park Engineering 3.0 featuring RITchie's Outer Space Adventure. Blast off on an adventure of engineering and creativity in our fully functioning theme park with over thirty rides and attractions. Experience the thrill of controlling your own roller coaster or even dare to ride one as you see what it takes to design today's cutting edge entertainment. Get ready for an out of this world experience.
recreationZone.exhibitors: David Swerzenski, Caroline Kruse, Catherine Osadciw, Ben Fairlamb, Cory Rivera, Kevin Nie, Oldarlyn Castillo, Kevin Mejia, Jonathan Schiff, Kelly Dulcie, Emily O'Connor, Colin Bussert, Mike Troise, Chris Brucker, Andrew Kowalczyk, Robert Cybulski, Garrett Waldron, Cindy Castillo Lake, Mitchell Sweet, Meg Froehlich, Lauren Carney, Christine Van, April Lau, Ryan Hirschman

recreationZone.name: TigerBot RIT Humanoid Robot
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: RIT TigerBot VII is a full scale humanoid robot with 16 Degrees of Freedom, the culmination of years of iterative Senior Design projects.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Collin Mason, Daniel Watson, Felisa Sze

recreationZone.name: Understanding Dwarfism
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: Understanding Dwarfism is a program dedicated to changing the world's perception of a group of people who throughout history have been misunderstood and stigmatized because of their profound short stature. Our hopes are that through education, understanding and awareness people will begin to see persons with dwarfism as individuals making positive contributions to society - equally capable and deserving of a life free of stereotypes and equal to that of any other.
recreationZone.exhibitors: John Tassone, Todd Howell, Stephen Olesik, Darryl Kramer, Annika Howell, Megan Howell

recreationZone.name: VIGN: Media Entertainment in Sign Language
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: VIGN is a new kind of media entertainment site where millions of people can discover and watch signed videos covering news, sports, culture, arts & leisure and family programs -- all in one place. Visit us to learn more and be one of the first to watch VIGN when it launches.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Mohd Afifi Ishak, Tobin Zolkowski

recreationZone.name: Wheelchair Accessible Restroom
recreationZone.building: Gordon Field House and Activities Center
recreationZone.description: The ADA defines a wheelchair-accessible bathroom as being 60 by 56 inches with approximately 840 square inches being consumed by the actual toilet fixture. Most facilities are required to have two grab bars, placed 33 to 36 inches above the floor and next to the toilet. This team focused on redefining the wheelchair-accessible bathroom to be more user friendly for people with disabilities.
recreationZone.exhibitors: Tyler Roneker, Ben Marus, Thomas Skudlarek, Evan Bartlett, Nina Zheng, Veronica Santoso

ritCentral.name: A Day at Hogwarts
ritCentral.description: A Day at Hogwarts will take you through the classes offered at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Get ready to be immersed in the world of Harry Potter and learn about Ancient Runes, Potions, Herbology, Care of Magical Creatures, and more! Our exhibit will have activities throughout the day that will allow you to connect back to the Harry Potter books and movies through puzzles and snacks.
ritCentral.exhibitors: Kim Callahan, Lauren Carney, Samantha Herman, Sydney Kasok, Leah Ruth, Morrgan Sweeney-Charlton, Elyse Rood, Amanda Weiss, Nathaniel Stoll, Tyler Anderson, Camden Brockbank

scienceCenter.name: Black Holes, the Sound of Cosmic Collisions
scienceCenter.description: Our exhibit will demonstrate how Black Holes can be observed, and how scientists are able to use Supercomputers to simulate the collisions of Black Holes, find Black Holes using LIGO, and determine how Black Holes affect everything around them. In our exhibit you will use the gravity from Black Holes to control lasers, bend light and save the Earth from alien invasion, or you can play ping pong. Come see a scale model of LIGO and learn how scientists detected the invisible.
scienceCenter.exhibitors: Hans-Peter Bischof, Manuela Campanelli, Joshua Faber, Jake Lange, Carlos Lousto, Vassilios Mewes, Jason Nordhaus, Jam Sadiq, Andrew Williamson, Daniel Wysocki, Yosef Zlochower, Dennis Bowen

technologyQuarter.name: A Novel AR Game for Spatial Ear-training
technologyQuarter.description: We present a novel spatial ear training program using a head-mount AR display. In a game format, the user is asked to indicate the perceived location of the target sound. The proximity of the indicated location to the actual target is converted into scores. Multiple levels of difficulty take users to proceed from the easiest level to the most difficult. This system is expected helpful for those who want to develop better spatial mapping, including sound engineers and new cochlear implant users.
technologyQuarter.exhibitors: Song Hui Chon, Sungyoung Kim, Justin Levine

thinkTank.name: Bailemos en la Plaza
thinkTank.description: Latin Rhythm Dance Club brings the styles of Latin dance to the RIT student community and now, to Imagine RIT! Our exhibit includes a lesson on Salsa/Bachata Basics by our student instructor as well as performances by our Performance Team! The performances will showcase Salsa, Bachata, Kizomba; all student created choreography! We encourage spectators to become active participants in the lesson, no experience required and all are welcome!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Zoe Kniskern, Melissa Mendoza, Jose Batista Abikarram , Jimmy Zhang, Kelly Vo, Weinishet Tedla-Boyd, Mike Valentin, Luke Laffey, Javier Albert, Nicole Badia, Harry Longwell, Allison Suarez, Thomas Sosa, Nick Querci, Moisés Lora, Arion Rivera

thinkTank.name: Battery-Powered Centrifuge
thinkTank.description: Have you ever wondered how remote areas in Haiti receive medical care without electricity and technology? The Rochester-based organization Haiti Outreach: Pwoje Espwa (H.O.P.E.) coordinates mobile clinics in remote areas of Haiti that provide residents with laboratory services. The isolation and lack of electricity greatly hinders the mobile clinic's ability to conduct laboratory tests. Come and find out how we designed a tool to provide Haiti with medical care. Test it yourself!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Ashlynn Palmitesso, Kenneth Mohrman, Raven Benfield , Cole Williams, Yuan Wang, Christian Leibfried

thinkTank.name: Capoeira Angola Quintal Performance
thinkTank.description: Capoeira is an Afro-Brazilian martial art, created by slaves and hidden through dance and music. Capoeira is played as a game between two practitioners inside of a circle of spectators, other capoeira players, and a band of musicians.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Jeremiah Jordan-Ferguson, Matthew Gould, Vincent DiCocco, Samuel Tom

thinkTank.name: Economics of Bioplastics
thinkTank.description: Bioplastics are of increasing interest to food packaging firms. While they generate several benefits, they also tend to be costly. This study explores the economics of how firms choose between plastics for food packaging, and how government policy can be used to raise investment in relatively greener bioplastics.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Devon Southwick

thinkTank.name: Economics of Software Bug Bounties
thinkTank.description: Why do some software companies offer 'bug bounties' to third parties for finding/fixing software bugs? Is this the most efficient way of reducing software bugs to efficient levels? This study combines economics and computer science to examine these two questions.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Christopher Sprague

thinkTank.name: Economics of Solid Waste Aftermarkets
thinkTank.description: How can economic forces be harnessed to move more solid waste through landfills to aftermarkets where materials could find further usage? We show how principles of economics and environmental sustainability could be combined to incentivize the further development of landfill residual aftermarkets.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Jeffrey Wagner, Maximilian Schreck

thinkTank.name: Environmental Science in Your Own Backyard
thinkTank.description: RIT students and faculty in Environmental Science are learning about the environment of Monroe County and doing great things to make our environment healthier. Visit us to learn about the plants, animals and ecosystems right in our own backyard and see how RIT Environmental Scientists and our community partners are using science and technology to understand and improve our world!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Karl Korfmacher, Carrie McCalley, Robert Moakley, Joshua Strobel, Alex Shipman, Olivia Pine, Paige Baker, Emily Pacifico, Zachary Ursu, David Connell, Zack Prokocki-Loomis, Melanie Morris, Elizabeth Hane, Ibrahim Cisse, David Fong, Caleb Guillaume, Kelleen McGuinness, Christy Tyler, Alexanna Page, Delanie Spangler, Erica Short, Sarah Goldsmith, Josephine Ibanez, Rachel Bratek, Laura Denlinger, Ashley Berna, Joseph Porsella

thinkTank.name: Freedom of the Press: Printing 18th-Century Style
thinkTank.description: In 2016, an ambitious team of RIT students produced a functioning and historically-accurate wooden printing press. Visitors will print a copy of the First Amendment of the United States Constitution on the press and experience how documents, books, and newspapers were produced in the 18th century. Also on hand will be interpreters from the Genesee Country Village & Museum who will demonstrate the blacksmithing techniques used to make the press' metal parts.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Steve Galbraith, Matthew Schofield, Becky Wehle , Daniel Krull, Ferris Nicolais

thinkTank.name: Ham Hunt with K2GXT
thinkTank.description: Join RIT's Amateur Radio Club K2GXT on a scavenger hunt to find one of our club members! Come to our table to find out what you're looking for and learn about amateur radio. If you find our club member you will get a prize!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Sara Tibbetts, Christopher Culpepper, William Fanelli, Wylie McDonald, Scott Czeck, William Kommritz, William Leuschner, Sam Feine

thinkTank.name: Mental Graffiti Poetry
thinkTank.description: Mental Graffiti will be doing Blackout Poetry! A fun, casual activity to get more people interested in creating poems, because everyone can and everyone should!
