Come see us perform on the Global Village Stage as well at 2:30 or visit us at our outdoor booth near the Mobius Quad!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Katherine Smith, Rachel Baumgarten, Ash Hrim, Nathan Tomlinson

thinkTank.name: Multispectral Imaging Drone
thinkTank.description: How can an archaeologist find artifacts without excavating the site? Our imaging system provides the solution! Combining several lighting modalities, we are providing archaeologists with an imaging system that acts as a survey tool. Come see our senior design project to learn more about how we're helping a professor here at RIT collect information about his site in Oaxaca, Mexico examining Mayan ruins. You'll be able to see our sensors, made-from-scratch gimbal, and of course the drone!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Leah Bartnik, Ben McFadden, Stephen Depot, Ryan Moore, Arthur Svec, Jeremy Sardella

thinkTank.name: Performance by Proof of Purchase
thinkTank.description: Members of the co-ed a cappella group, Proof of Purchase, will sing pop/ feel-good songs, a cappella (without instruments). There will be 1-3 soloists per song while the rest of the group sings background parts and vocalizes the percussion parts of the music.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Emily Gray, Andrew Carter, Steve Barone, Hayley Briner, Jenna Rahrle, Emma Belair, Chris Renninger, Sofia Quinones, Thomas Flynn, Maura Hess-Mahan, Chris Webster, Michael Coy

thinkTank.name: Pi Tau Sigma: Six Simple Machines
thinkTank.description: RIT's chapter of Pi Tau Sigma, an International Mechanical Engineering Honor Society, presents an interactive exhibit to learn about simple machines. Geared towards kids, this exhibit demonstrates the mechanical advantage provided by a lever, wheel, pulley, inclined plane, wedge, and screw. Exhibitors explain the engineering principles behind the machines, then visitors try the machines for themselves to discover how much easier it is to otherwise induce motion when aided by a simple machine.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Alison Wright, Tim Frey, Wylie McDonald, Reese Salen, Solomiya Vysochanska, Allison Moulton, Anthony Iannuzzi, Ian Kurtz, Scott Geyer, Michael Gydesen

thinkTank.name: Promoting Undergraduate Research in Economics
thinkTank.description: This exhibit showcases the undergraduate research process in Economics at RIT. See examples of undergraduate student involvement in the design and completion of economics research studies. Undergraduate researchers and faculty mentors will be on hand to discuss a wide range of economics research projects--both the research process as well as the results.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Jeffrey Wagner

thinkTank.name: Reimagine the Infinity Statue
thinkTank.description: Our goal is to improve RIT's Infinity Statue. The artist's intent was to represent the idea of infinity; both through the 3 sided mobius mounted and top and through it's continuous rotation. The drive train responsible for this rotation has required reoccurring maintenance, resulting in the statue remaining stagnant for long periods of time. The intent of this design project is to re-design or modify the statue's drive train to assure that the statue's artistic intent is realized.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Marlon Izaguirre, Matt Frank, Matt Hyer , James Seidel

thinkTank.name: Resonant Freqs: An Interactive Rock & Roll Band
thinkTank.description: Resonant Freqs is a unique rock & roll band that performs songs in ways that engage audience members in various ''X-along' routines, where X is an element of the ever-expanding set {dance, sing, clap, slap, hop, skip, jump, shake, rub, . . . }. To celebrate the 10th anniversary of ImagineRIT, special guest singers and interpretive dancers will be joining them for their last number of the show, an audience-participatory rendition of the song 'Can You Imagine'.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Jay Alan Jackson, Babak Elahi, Adam Wilcox

thinkTank.name: RIT @ NASA Micro-g NExT
thinkTank.description: Come learn about and interact with a tool designed for NASA spacewalks of non-terrestrial bodies! The RIT Micro-g NExT team will share their design for this year's challenge and visitors will be able to experiment with this sample collection tool.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Drew Walters, Mark Olles, Cayla Denning, Christopher Callejo, John Unterhalter, Frank Polito, Daniel Vasconcellos, Joshua Bush

thinkTank.name: Signatures Art and Literary Magazine
thinkTank.description: Signatures is RIT's award-winning undergraduate art and literary magazine. At Imagine RIT, we will be passing out free copies of our new issue, Issue 32, which contains poetry, prose, and art from RIT students. Throughout the day, we will also have poetry and prose readings from our contributors.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Heather Cottone, Robert Glick, Daniele DiPasquale

thinkTank.name: SoC Presents, Wordistry and Communicate This!
thinkTank.description: Stop by the Scholar's Bench between 10:00am and 1:00pm to participate one (or both!) of these exciting contests brought to you by the School of Communication! Communicate This! challenges you to deliver a 15-20 second speech and post it to Facebook. By the end of the day, the speech with the most 'likes' wins the prize. Wordistry is a a language-creation contest contest inviting you play with words and definitions. Words are added to our language on a regular basis. Telling someone you are taking a 'selfie' would have raised eyebrow a few short years ago. What new word can you add to the American lexicon? The best submissions as judged by a panel of students and faculty from RIT's School of Communication will win a valuable prize!
thinkTank.exhibitors: Keri Barone, David Neumann, Elizabeth Reeves OConnor

thinkTank.name: The Biodiversity of One Cubic Foot
thinkTank.description: Come see the biodiversity in the local area! Based upon the beautiful work done by David Liittschwager, Freshwater Ecology and the Seneca Park Zoo teamed up to photograph the amazing life found on a tributary of the Genesee River. Photographs were taken of all the organisms that passed through a one cubic foot space.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Katherine Hensel, Elizabeth DiCesare, Sarah Balaschak, Rachel Bratek, Emily Bush, Nicole Dergosits, Michael McGowan, Hailey Richmond-Boudewyns, Dylan Sanders, Zachary Sutherby, Teresa Zgoda

thinkTank.name: The Economics of Low Earth Orbit Pollution
thinkTank.description: Low Earth orbit (LEO) pollution from satellites is of increasing concern. What has caused the pollution levels of the present LEO environment? We show that the problem mirrors a tragedy of the commons scenario. A key factor is that satellite launchers inefficiently discount the exponential creation of debris as satellites collide over time. We explore how this inefficiency can be corrected.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Zachary Grzelka

thinkTank.name: The RIT String Quartet
thinkTank.description: The RIT String Quartet is a student-only and student-managed string quartet with the main goal of performing high-level repertoire for receptions, concerts, & events. Our mission is in showcasing the diverse talent that flourishes at RIT, and in what better way than by holding a free concert outdoors for all of the RIT community? Following the performance, visitors will be free to converse with members to ask questions about RIT, and in particular, the benefits of joining RIT Performing Arts.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Ryan Mraz, Maddie Mooney

thinkTank.name: Toastmasters Public Speaking Competition
thinkTank.description: Toastmasters: is a proven program to improve their communication, public speaking, and leadership skills. For Imagine RIT, we will be having a table topics competition, where we throw out a quick prompt and anyone can come up and, in a given amount of time, answer that prompt. The speaking time for the contestants will be 1-2 minutes.
thinkTank.exhibitors: Sara Ali, Dalia Rehab, Katia Hudspeth, Pritam Poddar, Xavier Tarr, Deepti Chintalapudi
